source: Jenny was addicted to sending text messages. Jenny texted even while she was driving. While Jenny was replying to a text she took her eyes off the road. Jenny heard a horn honk and saw she was on the wrong side of the road.
target: Jenny narrowly avoided a car accident.

source: Elle wanted a new car. She went to the dealership and selected the perfect one. The dealer helped set up a payment plan for her. Every month Elle paid five hundred dollars towards the car's price.
target: Elle was very responsible.

source: Jay was having car trouble. He puttered into the garage. He was afraid the repair would prove costly. But the mechanic gave him some good news.
target: The mechanic told Jay that was only a minor repair.

source: Ned was hiking in the woods when he saw a  lump of fur under a tree. The lump started to move, then emitted little cries. Ned moved closer and saw that it was a bunch of tiny baby possums. He called the local wildlife rescue and reported the baby possums.
target: He waited until wildlife rescue arrived to save the baby possums.

source: Don's friend pulled Don's pants down in front of his graduating class. Don was angry and embarrassed at being exposed in this way. Don decided that this friend would no longer be his friend. Don's shame and embarrassment grew.
target: Don never forgave his friend.

source: One day I went outside and my dog was not there. I panicked. I had no idea where she was. Suddenly, my neighbor called me from next door.
target: The neighbor had my dog.

source: I met my husband to be at Costco. He drew horns on my membership picture and flirted wildly. I don't know why I said yes to a date, but I did. Five Years later, we married.
target: Eventually we had children.

source: Cindy was at a restaurant. And she ordered hot soup. But the waitress forgot to tell her that the bowl was hot. So when received the bowl from the waitress, she hurt her hands.
target: Cindy went and ran cold water over her hands.

source: Laura has always loves swimming, but she has never tried backstroke. She usually avoids backstroke because doesn't want water in her ears. One day she decides to take backstroke lessons from an expert swimmer. She finds that she loves backstroke and doesn't get water in her ears.
target: From then on, she swims the backstroke constantly.

source: One day I decided I wanted to walk into town. It wasn't far from my house, only a few miles! Once I arrived in town I decided to stop for coffee. I chose an awesome little shop and sat down for lunch.
target: I had a wonderful time!

source: Jess hated egg salad. When her friend's mother served it, she knew she had to eat it. Just as she was about to take a bite the family dog walked by. No one was looking so she lowered it towards the dog.
target: The dog happily ate the salad.

source: Robbie and I went to a fancy restaurant for our anniversary. It was very elegant. We both had to dress formally in order to get a table. We enjoyed TEN courses over four hours.
target: Robbie and I dressed up for the occasion.

source: Lonnie was fed up with modern life. He decided to go off the grid. He found a clearing in the woods and set up camp. The first night was scary, as he heard howls and much rustling.
target: After the initial noises Lonnie settled in for the night.

source: Bob had to get to work in the morning. His car battery was struggling to start the car. He called his neighbor for a jump start. His neighbor came over and helped him get his car running.
target: Bob made it to work on time.

source: Ava needed a plane ticket across the country. She feared it'd be expensive. Then the agent told her something wonderful. She had earned enough miles to pay for her ticket!
target: Ava was able to fly without spending any money on her ticket.

source: My friend Sharon was nervous yesterday. She found out her company wanted her to retire. Although she has a good pension, she was still nervous. I helped her rewrite her resume, preparing for a job search.
target: Sharon is now looking forward to a new chapter in her life.

source: Nita was playing rummy with her dad. She had lost ten games in a row! They wagered their points on one last game. Nita played hard and well, and she won!
target: Nita was so happy she finally beat her dad at rummy.

source: Tina was having her first skating competition. She was incredibly nervous. She was afraid something would go wrong. Thankfully she did great.
target: Tina took second place in the competition.

source: Neil took a tour to the taj Mahal. He admired the beautiful design of it. Then he heard the sad story behind it. Neil was impressed by the obvious labor of love.
target: Neil was glad he had seen the taj Mahal.

source: Mark and Frank were swimming in Mark's family's pool. Mark's mother brought out a sponge ball to them. Mark and Frank had fun tossing the ball back and forth. But then the saturated ball accidentally hit Mark's mother!
target: Mark and Frank apologized profusely.

source: Ty was nervous about attending summer camp not knowing anyone. The first day, he met Sam playing soccer. That night, he met Brenda at the campfire. At breakfast the next morning, he met Bill.
target: They all hung out at the lake that afternoon.

source: Vince was craving something sweet. Vince did not want his usual dessert of ice cream. Vince drove his car to Yogurtland. Vince got 10 ounces of frozen yogurt.
target: He shared it with a cute girl he met.

source: Ned wanted to learn to play basketball. He hung out in the school gym watching the team practice. Soon he felt confident enough to shoot a few hoops himself. The team watched him play and they cheered.
target: Ned's skills improved as he practiced.

source: Buck had lost his house and job. Ashamed, he sat on the road to panhandle. Then a woman approached him and told him about a shelter nearby. Buck, intrigued, went to the shelter right away.
target: Buck was glad that the woman helped him.

source: Josh liked bees. He thought they were good for the planet. One day, Josh got stung by a bee. It hurt very much.
target: Josh doesn't like bees so much any more.

source: Last week my girlfriend and I bought three lottery tickets. It's not something we normally do. We were desperate for money. Even a long shot was worth it.
target: We were happy to win a small amount of money from the tickets.

source: Fred always stopped at the same coffee shop before work. He got to know the attractive barista. He developed a crush on her. Finally Fred worked up the courage to ask her on a date.
target: She said yes.

source: Jenny was at the store hungry one day. She wandered around thinking about what she wanted to eat. When she came upon the cookie aisle she knew exactly what she wanted. She grabs some cookies and heads towards the front of the store.
target: Jenny bought the cookies.

source: Bob knocked on the door and asked for Jenny. Jenny answered and walked outside to the car. Jenny and Bob drove to the movies. Bob and Jenny had a good time.
target: Bob kissed Jenny good night.

source: I got a new truck. To celebrate, i went mudding. I drove through lots of mud puddles. my truck got really dirty.
target: Afterwards, I washed my truck in the driveway.

source: Peter was excited to go to the Sanders rally in New Hampshire. As Peter entered the arena it was full of thousands of people. When Peter saw Bernie he cheered as loudly as possible. He felt thrilled to be there.
target: He couldn't wait to vote for him.

source: Josh was writing short stories for a researcher. The researcher was impressed by Josh's stories. The researcher decided to give Josh a bonus. Josh was happy that he got a bonus.
target: Josh used the bonus to repair his broken car.

source: Ethan loved to make Youtube videos. However, he was too embarrassed to upload any videos. One day he gained the courage to upload one. Soon he had one hundred views!
target: Now, Ethan wanted to make and upload even more Youtube videos.

source: I was walking in the park one day. A stranger approached me to ask for change. I told the man I didn't have any money. The man kindly said thank you before he walked away.
target: Perhaps another person in the park can help him.

source: Gina and her friends were outside of the school library. They wanted to go inside. But the librarian was not in in the library. The girls weren't sure where she could be.
target: They decided to wait for her.

source: Ana was swimming in the lake. She swam across the whole lake and to the raft on the other side. She prepared to swim back, but then she stopped. She saw a huge, scary fish swimming in the water!
target: She screamed for her friend, unsure what else to do.

source: A man bought his young son a bicycle. It was the same brand of bike he'd owned himself as a boy. His bike had lasted until he outgrew it. His son's bike, though, fell apart after only a few weeks.
target: The man was very annoyed.

source: Jaime wanted to ask jack to go to the school dance with her. After school she waited for jack outside of the front door. When jack was exiting he was walking hand in hand with another girl. Jaime froze unable to speak.
target: Jaime then told him that they were through.

source: Billy's friends thought that he was a scaredy cat. They dared him to go into the haunted house. He decided to go in and even stay the night there. Despite how scared he was he stayed the entire night.
target: Billy felt brave.

source: Ana had just had a baby girl. She wanted her girl to have pierced ears. She took her baby to the studio and had her ears pierced. Then she fastened tiny diamond studs into the piercings.
target: Ana loved the earrings.

source: Sally wanted to do something special for her mom. She went and bought her a dozen red roses. Her mom loved them putting them in vase on the table. They admired the roses while they ate dinner.
target: Sally's mom appreciated the effort.

source: When I was sixteen I stole some hats. I had the money to buy them, I just didn't. Before I could leave the store the security had already grabbed me. They handcuffed me and walked me through the mall.
target: I was so ashamed I never stole again.

source: Matt started playing baseball when he was seven. Now seventeen Year's old he still had not hit a homerun. Today was not only his last game, it was also the championship. Bottom of ninth, Matt was up at bat with two strikes to his name
target: The next pitch he hit a homerun.

source: It was Cara's sweet sixteen. She had a massive party with her friends. When the party was done, her parents told her to go outside. When she went outside she saw a brand new car.
target: She took the car for a drive and thanked her parents.

source: Darlene just moved to a new city and has no friends. Darlene was looking for shelves in thrift stores for her new home. A customer and cashier struck up a conversation with Darlene. They seemed friendly and had similar interests.
target: She made fast friends with the cashier and customer.

source: Jake is one of my roommates. He took a gap year last year to work as a chef in Australia. Since the dining hall food was subpar we decided to cook. He taught me how to cook and season a steak.
target: Jake has kept all of us well-fed all year.

source: Yesterday I went to the animal shelter. I have been in search of the perfect dog for my family. I fell in love with a dog named Toby. After introducing him to my cat we decided to take him home.
target: My family all loved Toby.

source: Tony was tired of stale store bought bread. He called his mom and got her bread recipe. Tony gathered the ingredients that he needed. Tony baked the bread according to the recipe.
target: It was some of the best bread he has had.

source: Selena was a music artist with a lot of fans. One of them was too obsessed. He kept following her places in public and sending her creepy messages. She decided to go to the authorities.
target: Selena made sure the person was arrested.

source: Sam loved breakfast. He particularly loved frozen waffles. He would make four of them every morning when he woke up. When he woke up this morning three were in the box, not four.
target: Sam ate three waffles this morning.

source: A young toddler was climbing up a chair in his living room. As he climbed, his foot slipped and he fell to the ground. The boy started crying very loudly. His mother heard him from in the kitchen and ran over to him.
target: The mother comforted the child.

source: Rick was trying to go to sleep. But there was a fly flying around his room. The noise of it was so irritating. But he was too exhausted to try to catch the fly.
target: He turned on the radio to try and drown out the noise.

source: My friends wanted to play Dungeons and Dragons last week. We got together with drinks and started to play. Things quickly deteriorated as we kept drinking. Eventually we pretty much stopped playing and just hung out.
target: We had a good time.

source: Jen screamed out her window that no one cared about her. Her neighbors yelled for her to shut up. Jen screamed even louder and now with profanities. The neighbors called the cops.
target: Jen had the cops show up at her front door.

source: Logan and Maria decided to make a film together. They wrote the script and hired the actors. After a lot of work, finally the film was done. They invited everyone to come see it.
target: Logan and Maria were proud of the film.

source: Sam was sitting on the train reading the paper. He was on his way to a new job interview. Sam felt extremely nervous. A kind man sat next to him and offered him advice.
target: Sam learned from the old man's advice, and got the job.

source: A little girl wanted a puppy. Her parents told her no. She started to cry. She cried and cried until her parents caved.
target: They went to the animal shelter and picked out a cute puppy.

source: Sara eagerly awaited December 1st to come. When it finally did she went to her shed and pulled out tons of boxes. Slowly she started unpacking them and organizing their contents. She then began decorating the outside of the house.
target: She loved the lights.

source: Kate had been working out for months. She also kept a healthy diet. Her friends hadn't seen her in a while. When they finally did they were impressed by her dedication.
target: Kate was proud.

source: Robert was a math genius. Robert put in extra time and effort in his studies. He was invited to a statistics contest for young children. He was determined to win at all cost.
target: Robert studied hard and came in first place at the contest.

source: John was on a road trip. Suddenly he felt a strange bumping. He pulled over and checked his tire. It was flat as a pancake!
target: He called road assistance promptly.

source: In the autumn Samantha always gets a craving for apple cider. She dedicates a Saturday to drive to an orchard. Samantha walks the trails to enjoy the colorful leaves. She buys a few gallons of cider before she leaves.
target: Samantha loves the apple cider she gets at the orchard.

source: John hadn't studied for his math test. The weather forecast was calling for snow. He went to bed hoping he would be saved by a snow day. When he woke up the next day school was cancelled.
target: John was relieved to have an extra day to study.

source: Four Outlaws camped in Blood Gulch. They thought that they were safe, so they let their guard down. The sheriff was hot on their trail. He found them them early in the morning while they still slept.
target: He arrested them.

source: Josie found a spider underneath her bed. She sprayed a can of lysol all around the bed frame. Josie saw the spider crawl up the wall. She swats the wall with a piece of paper.
target: Josie hated spiders.

source: A man named Nick was walking down the street. He noticed a small leather wallet in the grass. He picked it up and it was filled with cash. Nick decided to give the wallet to the police station.
target: The police never found the owner so they gave it to Nick.

source: Ken was on vacation in the tropics. He was learning to scuba dive. He passed his certification course and then dived every day. Soon he was learning lots of facts about the ocean and exploring.
target: It was the best vacation Ken had ever taken.

source: I turned on the news one day. I saw sad news that there were hostages in a venue. I watched for a while and they said the hostages were shot. I cried and held my girlfriend who was with me.
target: I think terrorism is frightening.

source: Anne always wanted one of the lilies that grew in the pond. They were so far out, she could never reach them. One summer she took a rake and attempted to pull one in. To her shock, she still could not get the lily!
target: Anne was very sad.

source: Brian looked up a recipe for pork chops on the internet. He chose the recipe calling for barbecuing the pork chops. He followed the instructions and carefully prepared the ingredients. After going through all the steps, Brian tasted the pork chops.
target: Brain was happy that they tasted so good.

source: James was at the gym playing basketball. His clothes were soaked from running up and down the court. He forgot to bring spare clothes to change into. James had to run to his car in order to avoid the cold weather.
target: James drove home to get change into dry clothes.

source: Gina was given lunch detention. She was expecting worse. She fought the smile that tried to creep across her face. She didn't want the principal to know she was relieved.
target: Gina's smile broke into a laugh but the principal didn't notice.

source: Cole was given coal for Christmas as a gag gift. Cole was young and took it very seriously. Cole was well-behaved for months after that. Eventually Cole forgot about the incident.
target: Cole never got coal again.

source: Mike was tired of work and needed a vacation. Unfortunately, Mike had no idea where he should go. He then decided to spin a globe and go where his finger landed. Mike's finger landed on Hawaii.
target: Mike took a trip to Hawaii.

source: Tiffany bought a bag of microwave popcorn. She didn't read the directions. She put the bag in the microwave and pushed the popcorn button. Minutes later she smelled something horrible.
target: The popcorn had burned because she left it in too long.

source: We went snow skiing for my wife's birthday. In the lift line, we started talking to another couple. We found out that they were celebrating the wife's birthday. The four of us had drinks in the lodge that night.
target: We had our first swingers experience that night.

source: Nan felt guilty because her pets were alone all day while she worked. She considered getting rid of them, but knew she'd miss them too much. She realized the boy next door got home from school at 3:00 every day. She offered him five dollars a day to spend some time with the cats.
target: The boy watched her cats for her.

source: One Friday night we all pitched in and got a huge pizza. My brother bit into a slice that had a piece of gum on it. Disgusted, we called the pizza place to complain. They came by our house and denied everything.
target: We ordered from another store.

source: Henry ran across a baked goods sales. The young lady gave him a small muffin. He took a bite out of it. However, a worm came out of the hole.
target: Henry was disgusted and spit the muffin out.

source: Bob had recently just purchased his dream car. The only thing he didn't like about it was the color. He took it to the paint shop to get it repainted. He waited a week and then picked it up from the shop.
target: Bob loved the new color he chose.

source: My aunt is a nurse. She often talks about long hours at work. Last week was especially bad. She didn't have a single day where she didn't work late.
target: It was hard work.

source: Joe was walking home one night. Out of nowhere, a man approached and stabbed him. Joe was badly injured! He staggered to the nearest hospital.
target: It took him 2 weeks in the hospital to recuperate.

source: Fred just bought some new patio furniture for his house. He built it and set it all up outside himself. That night there was a bad rainy storm. The next day Fred saw that the rainy had ruined his new furniture.
target: He was disappointed.

source: Jordy ran outside happily. He looked up at the sky to see countless snowflakes. With a gleeful yelp, he began constructing a snowman. When he was done, Jordy looked thoughtfully at his creation.
target: He was proud of himself.

source: John was a student in law school. He was having a tough time learning all of the material. John decided to do something about this. He met with the professors and got extra tutoring.
target: Pretty soon, he was up to speed and feeling much more confident.

source: Harold was a mailman doing his job. He had one package with a mysterious address. Harold looked all over town, but could not find the house. He went to his van and looked it up in his database.
target: Harold found the address was correct but the city was not.

source: Amy wanted to get a manicure. She went to the nail salon near her job. The lady finished and asked if she wanted fingernail polish as well. Amy chose a bright red nail polish color.
target: Amy loved bright colors.

source: David went to John's lake house for the weekend. John's family owns a boat, so they took a ride. It was David's first time ever being on a boat, so he was nervous. The boat was going fast and David started having fun!
target: David decided that he enjoys boats afterall.

source: Nancy walked inside the subway store. She asked for a footlong chicken sub. However, she looked away when it was being prepared. She noticed that it was a half of a foot long.
target: Nancy demanded she be given the other six inches she asked for.

source: After math class, I decided to go to the library. I caught up on some assignments. I had to wait several hours for my mom to pick me up. Since I was extremely tired, I fell asleep completely.
target: I didn't get any homework done.

source: It was a beautiful, warm, fall day. Amy decided to go outside to enjoy the weather. She sat on the porch swing watching the squirrels run around. Just being outside began to lift her low spirits.
target: She stayed outside until the sun went down.

source: On Saturday, we went to the beach. I applied sunscreen before we left. I did not read the instructions well. I didn't reapply sunscreen throughout the day.
target: I got a sunburn.

source: Jane wanted to learn how to juggle. Jane consulted with a professional juggler to teach her. Jane went to three classes with the professional juggler. After three weeks, Jane was juggling.
target: Jane had a natural talent.

source: Tim like pasta a lot. He would make it every night for dinner. One night he didn't have the sauce for the noodles. He didn't know what to do at first.
target: Tim decided to order out.

source: Grandpa asked Betty if she wanted a drink. Betty said she wanted milk. Grandpa didn't know if she wanted chocolate or strawberry. Betty wouldn't tell him which kind of milk she wanted.
target: Betty was shy.

source: Bella sat by the campfire with her friends. They all had s'mores dangling over the fire, warming up. Each one of them took turns telling a scary story. When it was her turn she made sure to put her best acting to use.
target: Bella's friends were very frightened by her story.

source: Jasper notices that he has begun to develop dandruff in his hair. He feels very embarrassed about this. Jasper decides to buy a special anti-dandruff shampoo. Finally he notices that the dandruff is going away.
target: Jasper is happy.

source: Jane needed a new kidney. Only Bob was a match. Bob didn't know Jane, but that didn't matter. Bob gave Jane his kidney.
target: Jane was very thankful of Bob's generosity.

source: Amy arrived home from her vacation. She went to the baggage carousel to claim her luggage, all souvenirs! But as she waited, she grew nervous, not seeing her luggage. She went to the help desk and informed them her luggage was missing.
target: Amy was distraught.

source: Paige was trying to quit smoking cigarettes. It was hard because she had been smoking for ten Year's. She slowly cut down how much she was smoking. After awhile she stopped having cravings.
target: Now Paige is smoke-free and happy.

source: Gina was hungry. She was on a road trip and only had sweet snacks. Her dad insisted they keep driving instead of making a food stop. Her mother agreed with him.
target: So Gina suffered from stomachaches.

source: Ray and his friends planned to go to the beach. So Ray worked out to build up his muscles. When Ray and his friends went to the beach, they noticed Ray's body. Ray was happy to be the center of attention.
target: All his friends were jealous of his new physique.

source: Cristin went to a music festival. One of Kristin's favorite bands should be performing at the festival. She found out that her favorite band's performance was cancelled. Cristin is frustrated that she did not get to see their performance.
target: Cristin decided not to go to the festival next year.

source: Paul worked as order taker at a fast food drive thru. Customers noticed he had a really nice voice. People suggested he should work in radio. Paul quit his job at the fast food restaurant.
target: Paul got a new job as a radio dj.

source: Larry regretted that he hadn't seen his aunt in months. He decided to take the long trip to Idaho to see her. Larry packed his bags and drove to Idaho. His Aunt was very happy to see him.
target: Larry started making regular trips to see his Aunt.

source: Amy was going to buy coffee to beat her coffee crash. But there was no coffee machine in the school for kids. There was however a soda vending machine. Amy just needed to decide which soda had the most caffeine.
target: Amy picked a Pepsi to drink.

source: Reba worried that she was going to be a killer, like her father. He went to prison for murder. Reba spent her entire life doing good deeds. She became a nun, and comforted orphaned children.
target: Reba thought she was doing the right thing.

source: Cindy cooked and cleaned every single day. She grew tired of doing all the cooking and cleaning by herself. Cindy said she was not going to cook until she got help cleaning. The family had beans every night until they realized she was serious.
target: The family started to help.

source: Jeb liked peppermint candy. He always had peppermints in his pocket. One day, he saw a pretty girl buying peppermints in the store. He decided it was a sign and boldly asked her out on the spot.
target: Jeb finally got a date after months of looking.

source: Billy liked sitting by the pond. He would take a book and sit under the tree. His book was about frogs. He looked out onto the pond and a frog was staring at him.
target: Billy started reading his book out loud to the frog.

source: I decided to add a new fountain pen to my collection. I'd seen online videos of a nice pen called a Pelikan M800. So I went to the pen shop at my local mall. The shop had just the model of pen I wanted.
target: I bought the pen.

source: Jen was invited to a Christmas party. She went with a close guy friend. They drank wine and talked with the couples that were there. As the group sang carols, Jen and her friend kissed.
target: She felt it was meant to be.

source: Tom always wanted to be a singer. He's been practicing since he was 5 years old. He auditioned for american idol and got in. The hosts all liked his voice.
target: Tom was elated!

source: Jay went to the chicken wing festival in Buffalo, New York. He bought a ticket to sample dozens of wings. He ate all different flavors of wings. Jay was so stuffed full of Buffalo wings at the end of the festival!
target: Jay went home happy that he decided to go to the festival.

source: My neighbors are always playing loud music. It's not so bad during the day. They also play it at night, unfortunately. I finally asked them if they could lower the volume.
target: They agreed to lower the volume.

source: Joe was an amateur prospector. He went out in the hills to look for gold. Instead of gold, he found many small blue and green stones. He gathered them all up to be appraised in town.
target: Joe hoped they were valuable.

source: Robert's dog passed away last month and he's still upset. His wife wants to distract Robert with something. She suggests they go shopping for a new dog. Robert tags along and discovers that he loves looking at puppies!
target: Robert starts to feel better after playing with puppies.

source: Lulu was excited to try the new candy store in town. She immediately woke up early and ran over to it. Thankfully she was the first one to arrive. As soon as she walked in she grabbed a bucket.
target: Lulu paid twenty five cents for a full bucket of candy.

source: Teresa's mom was pregnant. Teresa was excited to have a new baby sister. However, when the baby came, she felt otherwise. She felt like her parents were not giving her any attention.
target: Teresa was sad and begged for attention.

source: Sal was nervous on his first day of high school. And as he sat in class, he felt intimidated by his peers. At lunch time, another student approached him. And that student felt the same way as Sal.
target: Sal found out he wasn't alone.

source: My roommate is a slob. He never washes the dishes but always uses them. I found an old one with mold in it. The smell was atrocious.
target: I yelled at my roommate for being disgusting.

source: Jason loves using a Macintosh at home but his office uses only PCs. He has trouble becoming familiar with the PC operating system at work. Jason buys a PC at home to become more familiar with it. Soon he has become an expert in using a PC
target: Jason got a raise at work for being so good at working a PC.

source: My wife had MLK day off. She slept in, and did not get up until 10 AM. We had a leisurely breakfast. She watched Little House on the Prairie while I surfed the net.
target: Then we had a relaxing evening covering on the couch.

source: I woke up one morning very hungry. I looked through my house but didn't find anything. I found a box of pancake mix eventually. I decided to cook several of them to eat.
target: I devoured the pancakes hungrily.

source: Keri was babysitting her niece on a weekday. She needed to put her to sleep early. Unfortunately the niece had too much energy. Keri convinced her to do exercises with her.
target: Then Keri took the child for  a  walk  to tire her out.

source: Kim wakes up and decides to drive to the mall. She gets there and promptly spends 250$ on a pair of shoes. Later, she finds a purse to match the shoes. After buying an outfit to match, she decides to head home.
target: Kim loved everything she bought.

source: Erica had to decide whether to take her final or go help friends. School was important to her, but her friend was in an emergency. Erica told her professor her situation. The professor said she could make up the final at a later date.
target: Erica was so grateful that her professor was understanding.

source: My old neighbor used to take Halloween too far. His costumes were very elaborate. One year, he decided to be Jason and hide under his garage door. He scared everyone, and the whole neighborhood complained.
target: The next year he didn't dress up at all.

source: Ben was waiting at the crossroads for a lift from his friend Tom. Tom had said that he would pick him up at 8:00 PM and it was after 9. Ben was frightened by odd noises he heard coming from the darkness. After a while Tom walked out of the shadows laughing.
target: Ben was annoyed that Tom had tricked him.

source: Barry loves bowling. However, he needed to find a place where he could bowl regularly. Barry looked through the yellow pages for a nearby bowling alley. Barry decided he would go bowling on Saturday at the new location.
target: Barry was delighted with the new alley.

source: The family prepared the food and packed it away. They walked to the nearest park. They laid out a blanket and began to set out their food. Everyone enjoyed sandwiches, fruit and more.
target: The family had a good day.

source: Brad and Allison love Texas country music. Brad found out there was a concert happening nearby. He invited Allison to go to the concert with him. Allison accepted the invitation.
target: They both had a good time at the concert.

source: Melissa had wanted to be a news reporter on television. Even since she was little, she practiced on camera. Her obsession followed her all through school. She attended college for journalism and made high marks.
target: After graduation, she was offered a job at NBC News.

source: Dot was tired of the being the strict mom. She picked up her kids, and took them straight to an ice cream parlor. From there they went to the movie theater, to see a superhero movie. They had popcorn and candy for dinner, with cookies for dessert.
target: Dot was now considered the cool mom.

source: It snowed so hard that school was called off for the day. The boys put on their coats, hats, gloves and boots and went outside. They built a tall snowman and a snow fort. They had a snowball fight.
target: They went inside to roast marshmallows.

source: I was walking to the mall. Someone was calling me and I decided to pull out my phone. I had a hard time getting it out since my pockets were tight. The phone ended up jumping out of my pocket.
target: I almost cracked my phone.

source: Bobby always enjoyed watching snow fall. When snow begins to fall from the sky he watches it. Sometimes he'll go out and stand while watching. The snow always sounds and feels nice.
target: Bobby let the snow cover him from head to foot.

source: Garry was nervous about his grades. Recently, Garry failed a Math test, and a English test. It is required that Garry have good grades to be on the football team. Garry's coach found out about his failing grades, and spoke with him.
target: If Garry doesn't improve his grades, he will be off the team.

source: Evan complained about everything. His girlfriend started making him dinner, but he said it smelled bad. She was so offended! She left mid-cooking, leaving the meal unfinished.
target: She broke up with Evan.

source: John made fun of his sister when she said yoga was a workout. He thought he was in great shape because he played basketball. One day his sister took him to a yoga class. He couldn't keep up with all the women.
target: John felt humbled.

source: Ava needed to go shopping with her two-year old. But she couldn't find his shoes even after looking everywhere! She decided she had no choice but to buy him new shoes. She carried him into the store in order to select a new pair.
target: Ava took good care of her son.

source: Harry was tired of the hot summer days. He decided to go swimming with his friends. Harry called his friends and set up the plans. They all met up at a local lake and drank beer and swam.
target: Harry and his friends had a great time at the lake.

source: Danny wanted  to  learn  how  to  make  fried  rice. His  friend  decided  to  teach him. His friend went to his house and taught him. Danny tried making it for himself.
target: Danny did a great job.

source: Meghan was hired as a Scientist II for a company. She loved her job and was very good at it. After a year, Meghan wanted more responsibility at work. She talked to her boss and had an evaluation.
target: Meghan hoped she would be promoted.

source: Core broke her parents glass antique vase. She was afraid of being caught. She swept the glass under the rug. Her parents came and took of their shoes.
target: Core's parents hurt their feet on the glass.

source: Bob got a rubix cube for Christmas. He struggled to solve the puzzle. Eventually, he was able to solve half of it. But, the full solution remained elusive.
target: Bob worked hard and then finally solved the puzzle.

source: Tim wanted to do something for his girlfriend on her birthday. Tim planned a romantic getaway in the Bahamas. Tim surprised her a week before her birthday. His girlfriend was so grateful for the vacation.
target: Tim was happy with her reaction to the gift.

source: Suzie decided to make her grandmother's spaghetti sauce. She made the sauce. She added mushrooms. She added the seasonings.
target: Suzie tasted the sauce, and it was just right.

source: Last weekend I wanted to buy some shoes. I needed a new pair from work so had to look for a place to go. I decided on the mall seeing as how they have a large variety. Once I got there, I quickly went to the store I had selected.
target: I found a perfect pair of shoes and bought them.

source: Gabby didn't have much money. She was working a minimum wage job. She spent the rest of her money on a lottery ticket. She got home and scratched it off.
target: She hoped the ticket was a winner.

source: Annie's grandfather needed a heart transplant. He was in the hospital for a very long time. When the transplant happened, her whole family was scared. However, he recovered with great health.
target: Annie's family was glad about the outcome.

source: When I was five, I moved. I had to go to a new school. I felt lonely on my first day. A kid walked up to me and introduced himself.
target: I felt less lonely.

source: Larry was scared of heights. He always planned his travels to avoid any tall bridges. Unfortunately for Larry, one day he was diverted onto another route. Larry started sweating as he saw the bridge looming over him.
target: He turned around to choose another route.

source: Jeff is a very quick thinker. He can get out of  just about any situation he doesn't want to be in. All he has to do is come up with an excuse on the spot to leave. He uses this a lot when he doesn't want to talk to his in-laws anymore.
target: Jeff hates spending time with his in-laws.

source: Binh decided to wash her cat. She picked up her cat from the deck. Then she filled the bathtub with water. Binh coaxed the cat into the water to wash it.
target: The cat ended up squeaky clean.

source: I ordered a family meal at a Chinese restaurant. As soon as I placed it on the table, my family attacked it. They were eating a lot out of the meal. After everyone ate, there was no food left.
target: I was happy we found a new favorite restaurant.

source: Humberto likes to jump on a trampoline. He has never fallen off and hurt himself. While jumping yesterday, he did just that. Humberto decided to retire from jumping on his trampoline.
target: He never fell off a trampoline again.

source: Matt met Tammy at a nightclub. Matt and Tammy exchanged numbers after the night. They talked on the phone every day. One day Tammy saw Matt with her friend Emma.
target: Tammy felt jealous when she saw Matt and Emma together.

source: Ben wasn't paying any attention as he walked past the windowsill. He swung his hand around. It hit the cactus sitting in the window. His hand was full of little needles.
target: Ben's hand was sore and he had to pull out all of the needles.

source: Janet was afraid of flying. No matter where she had to go she would always travel by land. One day Janet discovered that her mother was sick. She was very worried and the fastest way to get to her was by plane.
target: Janet realized she had to finally face her fear.

source: It was Nate's turn to sweep the floor this week. He was notoriously lazy. He decided to pay his roommate to do it for him. The roommate took the money and never did the work.
target: Nate had a hard time working up the energy to confront him.

source: Elena was a little person and was very insecure. She thought no one would want to date her. One day, she met a very nice full-sized man. They started dating and he accepted her condition.
target: He proposed to Elena after six months.

source: When Jay found out her older sister was pregnant, she was nervous. While she was happy for her sister, she was scared to be an aunt. Jay knew that there would be a lot of responsibility involved. But then, she finally came home from school and saw her nephew.
target: Jay immediately knew her fears were unfounded.

source: Jon was thirsty. He didn't have running water in his house. Jon decided to go buy some water at the store. Unfortunately, he got into a car accident on the way.
target: Jon regretted being thirsty in the first place.

source: Daria bought a television for her living room. She had the store deliver the television to her house. When the television arrived, Daria was excited. The television was her favorite thing.
target: Darla turned on her television and began to watch a movie.

source: White roses were Lilly's favorite flower. She grew them in her garden. One day she pricked her finger on a thorn. She thought nothing of it.
target: The prick got infected and she had to take antibiotics.

source: Jimmy's mother was sick in the hospital. He went to visit her at the hospital. Jimmy brought her flowers and a get well card. Her mother was very gracious.
target: Jimmy's mother started to get better.

source: Sammy had a terrible stomach ache one morning. But she forced herself to go to school. As she approached the bus, she thought of turning back. But she felt it was too late to change her mind.
target: She went to school and suffered through the pain.

source: Karmen was all ready for her trip to Tanzania. She got a taxi to the airport. She went through airport security quickly. She caught her flight on time and found her seat.
target: The plane took off and Karmen relaxed.

source: Sandy lived in New York. Sandy heard of a dangerous snow storm coming her way. Sandy decided to ensure that her home was prepared. During the snowstorm, the power went out.
target: Sandy was prepared.

source: Quentin ordinarily does not enjoy going to company events. Although he doesn't mind coworkers, he likes to be left alone. One day he decides to attend a company party. He eats some french fries to help himself from feeling awkward.
target: Quentin ended up enjoying the party.

source: I use Mister Spice no sodium sauce. I am on a low sodium diet. I tried to buy some bottles online yesterday. The computer kept rejecting my order, even though the card was active.
target: Finally the sale went through.

source: Dan wanted to go to school on Halloween dressed as the Devil. He was scared to ask his father for the costume. He asked his grandmother instead. She told him going as the Devil is evil.
target: Dan made his own Devil costume.

source: Franz decides he would like to be closer to his family. He books a trip to visit his cousin in Philadelphia. Franz and his cousin visit museums and drink coffee together. They have a terrific visit together.
target: Franz is glad he went to visit his cousin.

source: I bought a horned toad when I was ten. It was in a department store. The toad looked very fierce. We tried to feed it but it would not eat.
target: Eventually the horned toad died from starvation.

source: I met Nancy for the first time today. Before she left, we exchanged phone numbers. Despite walking for one moment, she constantly messaged me. I decided to call her and ask to stop calling me.
target: I never heard from her again.

source: Yesterday Kelly headed to cvs to buy some candy. She walked up and down the aisles to find what she wanted. To her surprise however, she ran into an old friend. The two talked for awhile.
target: Her friend ended up buying the candy for her.

source: Don's first day at the dock's had some hiccups. He was nervous being around heavy machinery. At one point he dropped a heavy shipment. It almost hit a fellow coworker.
target: Don knew he would have to improve.

source: Dal needed money to go to college. He started doing the accounting for a local gang. When the feds raided the gang, he was going over their books. He was accidentally shot dead in the crossfire.
target: Dal made a bad decision.

source: Today was Picture day at school. Alice was so excited because her mom had bought her a new outfit. She got up and got dressed and her mom fixed her hair. The photographer said she was very pretty.
target: Alice felt good after the photographer complemented her.

source: Nila's mom was diagnosed with stage four cancer. Nila knew her mom did not have a long time to live. Nila made sure to provide her mom with a good life until her death. Nila fostered many good memories with her mom and they were happy.
target: Nila loved her mom.

source: A mother looked at the face of her newborn baby boy. She dreamed of their future together. Her dream was to give him the childhood that she was not given. She sacrificed time and energy to accomplish her goal.
target: The boy had a very happy childhood.

source: Jessica and her brothers were very excited for Christmas. They went to sleep early so they could wake up early. They woke up and ran to the Christmas tree. There was only one box under the tree.
target: Jessica wondered if that they had gotten up too early.

source: Jan and Kim were both using the Montessori education model. Kim decided to take away all dragon and fantasy books from her kid. Jan was upset that Kim made this decision. Jan argued that imagination and fantasy was important.
target: Jan brought the books back.

source: The first day of school I walked there with two of my closest friends. We were all very nervous. When we got to school we checked the class list for third grade. All three of us were assigned to the same classroom!
target: We couldn't believe our luck.

source: Jeff was angry that his neighbor's dog always barked in the morning. And the barking always woke Jeff up early. One day, his neighbor gave his dog away. And Jeff was happy that he heard no more barking.
target: Jeff would finally get peace and quiet.

source: Holly asked her brother to put suntan lotion on her back. He took his time and applied it very carefully. Later that day, Holly wondered why people were laughing. She later realized her brother had made a design with the lotion.
target: Holly yelled at her brother to get back at him.

source: I used to make fun of my wife for having a nightlight. She was out of town a few days and I went to sleep without it. When I woke up in the middle of the night to get water I tripped. I couldn't see the clothes on the ground and got a bad bruise.
target: I never made fun of my wife and her nightlight again.

source: Amy decided to move from Wisconsin to Florida. She planned the move for months. On the day of the move she said goodbye to her friends. She drove all the way to Florida alone.
target: However the experience was no fun without her friends.

source: Kathy went shopping. She found a pair of great shoes. The shoes were $300. She bought the shoes.
target: She felt buyer's remorse after the purchase.

source: Amayah's birthday is coming up. She will be five Year's old. Her mom is throwing her a princess party. She is invited a lot of her friends from school.
target: Amayah is happy to be the princess at her party.

source: The boys and I went to the beach today. We took along a frisbee and a ball. While playing in the water some other people joined in. It was great making new friends.
target: I really enjoyed meeting some new boys.

source: It was Friday night so I decided to rent a movie. I headed down to a Redbox to get one. After taking an hour to decide I finally picked The Departed. I got home and made some snacks, then went to put the movie in.
target: It was the best movie I had seen in a long time.

source: Paula wrote a lot of spoken word poetry. Her friends were supportive even though it was bad. They invited her to a party. Paula started delivering some spoken word.
target: Her friends applauded her poem.

source: After getting off the school bus, I realized that my phone is missing. Since there was service on it, I decided to cancel it. The customer service representative did it for me. In addition, he said that there was a call made to Jamaica.
target: I knew someone had stolen it.

source: Today was Iris's fifth birthday! Her mom had planned her a surprise party. All of her friends were there. She opened presents and had cake.
target: Iris had a lot of fun at her party.

source: Tina always wore a red bikini when she went to the beach. She was known for it and everyone expected to see her in one. One day she met her friends in a blue bikini and surprised them. They couldn't understand why she would wear something different.
target: They liked the new bikini though.

source: Ted had always dreamed of being a homeowner. However, he had feared that it was a goal he would never reach. One day his father surprised him by saying he would help Ted out. Ted's father helped to split the down payment on a home with Ted.
target: Ted was grateful to his father for the help.

source: Evie wandered about the castle for hours. She explored every nook and cranny of the structure. Her supervisors quizzed her about what she had learned. She answered their questions brilliantly and with ease.
target: She was proud of herself.

source: Ed and his twin Ethan were looking at women online. Then they saw a profile for two twin ladies. They called Sami and Sara and arranged a date. On their date, all four had a wonderful time.
target: Years later both couples got married.

source: Marco is starting a new job today. He wants to look good on his first day. Marco decides to put on a necktie. His new boss is impressed with how good he looks.
target: Marco is glad that he made a good impression.

source: Tim wanted to travel overseas. He had never been on an airplane before. He decided to travel to China by air. He actually enjoyed the flight!
target: Tim started traveling a lot of places by airplane.

source: Lucy had a test tomorrow at school and she barely studied. It was already very late and she had to get to bed. The next morning school was concealed due to snow. Lucy lucked out and spent her whole day off studying for the test.
target: Lucy aced the test.

source: Fred liked mystery novels. He used to read at least one every month. When his friends found out, they all bought him one for his birthday. But unfortunately, he started getting irritated by the attention.
target: Fred told his friends he was taking a break from mystery novels.

source: Tia owned her own bakery. In her bakery, she made beautiful cakes. One day, she realized she was out of flour despite having a big order. She called all over the town and finally found some.
target: Tia was relieved.

source: Sarah went with her friends to the water park. They paid for their tickets and got into their swimsuits. They waited in line for the biggest slide. They went down the slide and had a lot of fun.
target: They went back the next day.

source: Jeb was building statues out of rocks. He made one that looked like a turtle. Sam came and knocked it down. Jeb started crying.
target: Sam laughed and ran away.

source: Jeff is going on a field trip to the rainy forest with his class. Jeff is excited and can't wait to go. When Jeff arrived he was very disappointed. The rainy forest wasn't exciting and there was nothing to do.
target: Jeff was bored and upset.

source: Dani was a nurse in the ICU. One night her estranged father was one of her patients. Dani didn't want to, but she treated her father. As he got better, the two of them were able to talk.
target: Dani got to know her father much better.

source: Gina was at her friend Ruth's house. A girl she didn't know named Jane showed up. Jane was rude, and stuck up. Gina later discovered Jane was her enemy Joe's sister.
target: So now she avoids Jane all the time.

source: Ella spent a day in the sun. She forgot to apply sunscreen. She got a nasty burn! But soon it faded and turned to a tan.
target: Ella looked great and got a lot of compliments.

source: Neil had just arrived in Kenya. He joined a safari tour group. They saw all kinds of exotic animals. Neil snapped photo after photo.
target: Neil composed a photo album when he got home.

source: Gina decided to bake an apple pie for the first time. She was extremely careful to follow the recipe exactly. After putting the pie in the oven, she eagerly waited to try it. It turned out to be delicious!
target: She shared the recipe and the pie with all her friends.

source: Pablo wanted a jawbreaker. He had no money however. He went through his closet to see what he could sell. He found a toy bear and sold it for 50 cents.
target: Then he bought his candy.

source: Anna rented out a warehouse for a big party. The decorations were great, but something was missing. Then Anna realized - they needed a disco ball! She secured a rented ball from a party supply company.
target: The party went great.

source: Oscar headed over to the nursery to find a tree to plant in his yard. He had a hard time deciding which tree to get. There were a lot of trees to go through. Finally, he opted on a Bonsai tree.
target: It went perfectly with his home decor.

source: There was a major basketball game in the gymnasium. Me and my friend played on the same team. The game became intense and both teams were tied in the end. There was 4 seconds left on the clock and we needed to score.
target: I shot the winning basket that won the game for our team.

source: Dirk was a fine pianist. He often performed out in public for money. During his last performance, one of the keys broke off his keyboard. He finished the performance as best he could, but the music was poor.
target: Dirk was embarrassed.

source: Eva loved the squirrels in her yard. She began to feed them peanut butter sandwiches. Soon they grew used to her. One was especially friendly.
target: Eva was able to pet one of the squirrels.

source: Andy loved the beach. He asked his mother if they could go to the beach. His mother took Andy to the beach. On the way to the beach, it started to rainy.
target: Andy was sad about it.

source: I bought a phone case with a lanyard. I needed one for my cell phone. The case arrived without a lanyard. The website said the case had a bracket but not a lanyard.
target: I felt foolish.

source: I changed the sheets on my bed last week. I was tired of the old ones. The new ones look nicer and feel better. I think I will keep them.
target: I am happy they weren't too expensive.

source: Chase really wanted a new toy. His mom would not purchase a new toy for him. She advised he save his allowance. He saved his allowance.
target: Chase bought himself a new toy.

source: Renee was inspired by the music of Eddie Van Halen. She decided to learn to play guitar. She bought an electric guitar and an amp. She hated pressing the strings with her fingers.
target: Renee decided she would have to get used to it.

source: Bill went fishing and caught a lot of fish. He caught so many he had to give some away. His neighbors were poor and were grateful to Bill for the fish. The neighbors finally got back on their feet.
target: They baked Bill some bread in appreciation for all the fish.

source: Last week the internet went out. My wife and I were bored out of our minds. Every other option available seemed boring. Eventually we just drank and talked for a while.
target: We ended up having a fun time after all.

source: All Tim's life, he wanted to make music. Tim practiced all day, everyday. When Tim had enough songs, he called a record studio. The studio decided to record him, and Tim was happy.
target: Tim became a professional musician.

source: Alex suspected that his cat Tigger might have fleas. Tigger was constantly scratching himself day and night. Alex took Tigger to the veterinarian to be diagnosed. The veterinarian confirmed that Tigger did indeed have fleas.
target: They gave him a flea medication and it cleared up.

source: Haley was a young scientist at a famous laboratory. Every day, she worked hard on her current project. One of her colleagues was secretly stealing her research. Haley discovered this when he published it in a scientific journal.
target: Haley felt like she had been betrayed.

source: Sam wanted to throw a party. Sam invited all of his friends and neighbors. The party got extremely wild. All of the guests left the party in disgust.
target: Sam had a terrible hangover the next day.

source: Katie couldn't sleep. She tiptoed downstairs and into the kitchen. She poured herself a glass of milk. Then she heated it in the microwave.
target: Katie drank it and went back to bed.

source: Tom was talking to his wife Becky who had a bad day at work. He decided to bring home her favorite meal as a surprise. On the way home from work, there was a lot of traffic. After getting the food, he arrived home much later than planned.
target: But everything was okay as soon as they hugged and ate dinner.

source: They had to pick out a stove for their new house. They couldn't decide on a particular brand. They liked the durability of the Viking. They also liked the deal with the Thermador.
target: They decided to buy the Viking stove.

source: Jasmine did not study for her big math test. She figured she could just wing it. Jasmine soon realized the test was very difficult. She decided to cheat by looking at her neighbor's paper.
target: The teacher caught her and gave her detention.

source: Sam moved to Los Angeles to become a movie star. He did not have much money but he thought that going is the only way. After two months sam was sleeping in his car and broke. He went to the chinese theater to beg one day.
target: Sam felt very depressed.

source: Ben woke up late. Ben decided to skip breakfast and went to work. Work was too busy to take a break or eat lunch. After work, Ben was caught in real bad traffic.
target: Ben was so hungry that he became sick.

source: Darren was late to work and could not find his car keys. He looked all over his house. He asked his wife were they were. She told him to check his pockets.
target: There were no keys in his pockets.

source: I had a job interview last week. My girlfriend helped me pick out a new tie. We went to the store and looked for hours. I found three I liked.
target: I bought all of them.

source: Harry loved hockey. He decided to sign up to play for a local league. Harry attended the tryouts for the team. Harry hoped he did well enough to make the team.
target: A few days later, Harry heard that he made the team.

source: Little Sue was riding an elephant at the zoo. She like it at first but then got scared. She started to cry for her mom. The zoo keeper had to stop the elephant and get her.
target: Sue's mom took her to pet the goat instead.

source: Hannah was an amazing artist. She always had a natural gift. She decided to enter in an art competition. Thankfully she was able to win the top prize.
target: Her parents were very proud.

source: Jim was taking out the garbage. He slipped on a piece of ice on the sidewalk. Jim fell down hard onto the pavement. Jim felt something break on his arm.
target: Jim was hurt and had to call 911.

source: I hate doing laundry. Matching socks is a horrible waste of time. Everytime i do laundry socks get lost. i was tired of searching for matching socks.
target: I threw out all my old socks and bought all plain white socks.

source: James was twelve Year's old and loved food. He never really thought about making food until today. His mother let him help fix rice for dinner. James learned how fun and creative cooking could be.
target: James decided to become a chef when he grows up.

source: Lee knew her mom needed new gloves and could not afford them. So Lee began to knit a pair. She hurried to finish them by Christmas. Then she presented them to her mom.
target: Lee's mom was proud of her daughter for being so thoughtful.

source: Jennifer was professional copywriter in a large city. She did good work but always received poor remarks on her reviews. Jennifer found out that her boss was trying to sabotage her! She decided to confront her boss about the negative remarks.
target: Jennifer stormed into his office and straightened her boss out.

source: Lorraine was a softball player. She was the best on her team. One day, during a game, she twisted her ankle badly. She wasn't able to play anymore.
target: Lorraine was really sad.

source: Abby and Tammy were the best of friends. They both loved to do things together that were fun and creative. They decided to make friendship bracelets together and give to others. Abby made five and Tammy made seven more.
target: They decided to keep the bracelets for themselves.

source: Last night there was a big lightning storm. It took out the power. The entire neighborhood didn't have electricity. It got really cold and we got scared.
target: Then after about an hour the power came back on.

source: Sal was mad that his parents were moving. They were moving to the eighth floor of a building. He hated living that high. After moving, he took a look out his bedroom window.
target: The beautiful view made him change his mind.

source: Lydia had a strange dream last night. She dreamed that she was taking a test at school. As she was taking the test she realized she forgot to put on pants! She was so embarrassed that she ran right out of the classroom.
target: Lydia felt relieved when she realized it was just a dream.

source: Alex needed groceries. She made a list of things to buy. She gathered her reusable canvas sacks. She walked to the store.
target: She bought the groceries.

source: Yolanda hates roller coasters. Katie does not understand why. She decided to force Yolanda to ride one with her. Yolanda vomited all over Katie.
target: Katie regretted forcing Yolanda to go on the ride.

source: One thing that Tina wanted to do in NYC was go to a hot dog stand. She finally saw a Nathan's stand and ordered a traditional one. The food tasted amazing. It was expensive but worth it.
target: She was happy with the hot dog.

source: Tammy likes to crochet. Christmas was a few weeks away and she didn't really have money. She got the idea to take the spare yarn she had to make a blanket. She then wrapped it up for her grandchild Lorelei.
target: Lorelei treasured that blanket for years.

source: Melinda wanted to go see a scary movie. She wanted to go by herself to prove she was brave. Melinda went to the movies and bought a ticket. Melinda was very afraid while watching the movie.
target: Melinda wished that she had brought someone.

source: Lamar learns that he will have unexpected houseguests one afternoon. He doesn't have any food at home to give to his guests. He decides to brew a pot of tea for them instead. His guests all enjoy the tea that he makes.
target: Lamar gave them tea to take home.

source: My niece applied for a job at the RMV two Year's ago. She got the job and was excited. They told her she needed a driver's license, which she did not have. She showed her employer a doctor's note showing she could not drive.
target: They decided it was ok to let her work as a secretary.

source: Lela was diagnosed with cancer five years ago. Everyday has been a struggle. She went to doctors and treatments almost every day. Lela finally started getting better the last few months.
target: Lela then finished treatment and felt better.

source: Fred was a new student in class. He was really awkward and he had a hard time. Nobody seemed to want to be friends with him. Later at lunch someone ate with him.
target: Fred talked with his lunch-mate and made friends.

source: Joyce was adopted by her foster mother when she was 5 Year's old. After her adoption her mom adopted 3 more children. Joyce loved being an older sister and she helped her mom a lot. When she moved out on her own she became a foster parent too.
target: Joyce loved her children just as much.

source: Horatio had always been afraid of eating a raw oyster. His girlfriend told him that it was delicious, but he was nervous. Finally she took him on a vacation to cape cod to try a fresh oyster. Horatio took his first bite into a raw oyster and loved it.
target: He ate ten more.

source: Tom liked to herd cattle. He did it every day. One day a cow went free. He searched everywhere.
target: He found the cow and brought it back.

source: Alyssa got some coffee on the way to work. She drank the coffee as she drove. Suddenly, she had to quickly stop her car. The coffee spilt all over her lap, scalding her legs.
target: She almost had an accident as she screamed out in pain.

source: John was driving down the highway. A Mustang pulled up next to him and kept speed. He was driving his new Camaro. They decided to race.
target: John won the race.

source: Ben wanted to win the costume contest at work this year. He spent many hours making his costume from scratch. To add to his costume he applied a lot of stage makeup. At work, everyone was impressed with how he looked.
target: Ben was pleased.

source: My mom asked if she can borrow $100 dollars from me. Considering that she's broke, I loaned my credit card to her. The next day, my credit card was declined when I tried to buy food. The company told me that I made a $320 dollar purchase.
target: I was angry at my mom for running up my credit card.

source: Kelly always had the driest hair. She had no clue what to do. Finally she went to the doctor. He prescribed her pills.
target: Kelly finally had hair that wasn't dry.

source: Sarah had a fear of being around others. She decided to force herself to go to a party. At the party, she became dizzy and nervous. Sarah decided this was enough, and went to see a therapist.
target: The therapist taught her ways to cope with her problem.

source: Ellen was at her doctor's office. She was about to find out the sex of her baby. She was really hoping for a boy! She held her breath as the doctor scanned her belly.
target: Her doctor confirmed it was a boy!

source: Zoey was taunted by her friends for having a strange name. She liked her name and wished people wouldn't be so mean. A new show was made that had a main character named Zoey. Zoey's name suddenly became very cool to her peers.
target: Zoey was happy that everyone liked her name now.

source: Miranda just got her driver's license. She took the family van out for a spin. She drove for a long time. But then she realized she was lost.
target: Miranda went back the way she came to retrace her steps.

source: Bob went to the doctor. The doctor told him that he was overweight. Bob realized that he had to get in shape. He joined a gym and started to watch what he ate.
target: Bob got in shape.

source: Lonnie was trying to figure out what majors to take in college. He knew that his end goal was to be a teacher. He asked the career counselor for advice. The counselor gave him a list of prerequisites.
target: Lonnie finally decided to go into education.

source: Sherry liked to explore the outdoors. She decided to hike in the state park on a sunny day. While walking along a creek she saw something shiny. Bending down, she picked up the shiny item.
target: It was a quarter.

source: Phil went for a walk in the park. It was a warm breezy day. He ran into a few friends along his walk. One of them offered him a drink.
target: Phil was thirsty and accepted the drink.

source: Dorothy's cat was pregnant. She didn't know how it happened. She convinced the family to keep the kittens. It wound up having 7 kittens.
target: Dorothy made sure to buy lots of cat food.

source: Jeremy's mother didn't approve of his lifestyle. When he was 21, Jeremy decided to move out. He found an apartment in a nearby state with a new job. After several Years he cleaned up, and finances his own life.
target: Jeremy enjoyed being more responsible.

source: Terry realizes his neighborhood has become covered in litter. He wishes it looked as clean as it did when he was young. He decides to pick up cans and cigarette butts every night after work. Eventually his neighbors do too and his neighborhood looks better.
target: Everyone felt better that it was cleaner.

source: I wanted to take a shower after work. I got my clothes and towel from the closet. I went into the bathroom and turned on the shower. I got undressed.
target: Then I stepped into the hot shower.

source: I approached the front of my school. Since my brother was at work, I had to wait for him to pick me up. Several hours later, I was impatiently waiting. He eventually came before night time.
target: I was very angry at him for not picking me up earlier.

source: Barry loved to lift weights. He only used his special barbell to lift weights. One day he forgot to bring his barbell! He decided to do cardio instead of lifting.
target: He still ended up having a great workout.

source: Amber had been working a lot lately. It was stressing her out a great deal due to other personal issues. She had been dying for a day off to relax. On her day off she hung out with boyfriend Rob
target: They relaxed all day and Amber felt much better.

source: Carl joined the military right after high school. He signed a short contract that put him on the front lines. His best friend was killed in front of him. Happiness became a foreign concept to Carl.
target: Carl had to go to therapy for post-traumatic stress disorder.

source: Eddie liked to watch people use metal detectors on the beach. He watched one man for a while. It had been over an hour and the man hadn't found anything yet. Eddie secretly buried a pile of quarters in the sand.
target: And watched the man happily get a ping.

source: When I first met Janice, she didn't know how to crack a walnut. I couldn't believe she had gotten this far in life without this skill. I offered to teach her many methods to crack nuts. She accepted.
target: Janice is now an expert walnut cracker.

source: Amy walked home from volleyball practice alone. She called and told her friend Kim she was the worst player. Amy felt like a loser just saying it out loud. Kim reminded her it was the first day, and she would improve.
target: And throughout the season she kept getting better.

source: Beth was taking a shower when she heard a loud knock on the door. She didn't want to answer and waited for it to go away. The next time she took a shower, she heard the loud knock again. But when she rushed out of the shower to answer, no one was there.
target: Beth decided she was hearing things.

source: Joe went to college for art. He graduated with a degree in painting. He couldn't find a job. He then responded to an ad in the paper.
target: Then he got hired.

source: Bob picked up his glasses from the table. He slipped them in his backpack to wear at school. He needed them to see the board. In science he put them on.
target: Bob was able to read the writing on the board.

source: I was really nervous before my first middle school dance. I was surprised my crush said yes to begin with. When we finally got the chance to dance I stepped on her foot. It wound up broken.
target: Now, she won't even talk to me.

source: My friend went out one night looking to find love. He ended up getting pretty drunk. The next thing we knew he was flirting with a gay man. After a while, we lost track of our friend.
target: Our friend ended up home at three am with a girl.

source: Benjamin went to the park today. First, he hung upside down on the monkey bars. After that, he went sliding down the slide. Then his mom pushed him on the swing and he went really high.
target: Benjamin had fun and then left the park.

source: Megan and I walked home from school near a busy street. I saw three blue cars pass by in a row. We decided to count the blue cars. Megan and I sat on the curb all afternoon.
target: After counting the cars, we went back home.

source: Kelly decided to have a house party. Her parents were going away so she decided to have one. She invited all her friends. When they got there they had a good time.
target: Kelly cleaned up in time and her parents never found out.

source: James realizes one afternoon that he hasn't left his house all day. He decides he will go for a run in the park. He had a long jog around the lake in his local park. When he gets home he feels tired but satisfied.
target: James is glad he decided to run.

source: Lars realizes that a lot of snow had accumulated on his deck. He decides he should shovel some of the snow. Lars works long all afternoon until the snow is cleared. When he is done, he goes inside for a shower.
target: He feels satisfaction.

source: Matt suspected his wife Ginny was having an affair. He began to sneakily read her emails. He found some emails that were from another man. Reading them, he saw that his suspicions were true.
target: Matt was very angry.

source: Mike used to play racketball with Perry. They would reserve a court a couple times a week. But one time Mike hit Perry by accident in the back of the head. Perry was not very happy about that.
target: Mike had to apologize.

source: Sydney needed to do the laundry. She sorted her dirty clothes by color. She dumped the first load into the washer. She added the detergent and fabric softener.
target: She continued to do this until the laundry was done.

source: There was a hurricane coming and we had to evacuate. We packed what we needed and headed to the other side of the island. We waited out the storm there with family. When it was over we packed our things and went home.
target: We found our house standing, but in shambles.

source: Tom bit into the Snickers bar and felt a jabbing pain. A small pebble in it made one of his teeth snap in half! He rushed to the dentist. Because it was an emergency, they saw him right away.
target: The dentist fixed his tooth.

source: Rufus wakes up and notices that his hat is gone. At first he cannot remember where it might be. Finally he realizes he wore it to the bar last night. Rufus returns to the bar to get his hat.
target: He sees his hat hanging on moose antlers behind the bar.

source: Alexia was excited to get a new dog. She had wanted a new dog for ages. Finally her parents agreed to get her one. They drove her to the kernel to pick one up.
target: Alexia fell in love with a shaggy dog at the kennel.

source: Dan wanted to find the perfect gift for his mother's birthday. He shopped at the mall for hours and was unable to find anything. He came home disappointed and without a gift. His mother saw his face when he walked in and asked what was wrong.
target: Dan explained the situation and his mother was not upset.

source: Bill was poor. Bill had a minimum wage job. He could barely pay his bills. Bill decided to get a degree in computer science.
target: Bill started making much better money.

source: Jane loved her new high heels. She wanted to wear them out. She wore them dancing to the club. Within minutes her feet hurt too much.
target: Jane danced in her bare feet and left her shoes in her purse.

source: Jose is an immigrant. He and his family came here from Mexico. Jose wants to take a trip to visit his other family members Mexico. He plans diligently and purchases the necessary travel items.
target: Jose take the trip to Mexico.

source: Hannah was feeling very stiff and inflexible. She decided to enroll in Yoga class to improve her flexibility. She was terrible at Yoga and for months she did not improve. But, she decided to stick with it and keep trying.
target: Hannah eventually succeeded.

source: The teacher announced that there would be a pop quiz. The students let out a collective groan. This was the second pop quiz in a week. As the teacher began handing out the quizzes, the fire alarm rang.
target: The students cheered because they were free.

source: Carla was worried that her daughter Ann was overextending herself. She'd seen her daughter's free time disappear with her new clubs. It all came to a head when Ann brought home a D on a test. Ann promised to work hard, begging to be allowed to stay in her club.
target: Ann's mom said her daughter could choose one club if she studied.

source: Gina's family was visiting her grandma in Illinois. It was the first day, and Gina was the last to wake up. She went to the kitchen to have breakfast. The family had already eaten most of the food.
target: Gina was sad and cried.

source: James had a birthday coming. He wanted a hunting bow. His mother went out and bought him one. He forgot to ask for arrows for the bow.
target: He carved some sticks to use for makeshift arrows.

source: A young girl named Taylor had always wanted a pet. One day her mother surprised her with a trip to the pet store. They both entered the store and looked around. Taylor had a hard time deciding which animal to adopt.
target: Taylor finally decided on the cute little kitten in the corner.

source: Zeke was throwing a Halloween party. All his friends were dressing up. Zeke thought about being a vampire or a wizard. Then he decided on a scarier costume.
target: Zeke dressed up like a skeleton.

source: Janet always wanted to be in movies. She finally landed a role in a big film. It was going to debut nationwide last week. Unfortunately it was delayed.
target: Janet was disappointed.

source: Marge begged her husband Bill for a backyard pool. He finally relented, and the pool was installed. Soon, Marge was throwing weekly pool parties. At one party, she saw a curvy neighbor in a bikini talking to Bill.
target: Marge felt a pang of regret about putting in the pool right then.

source: Rosie the quarter horse whinnied irritably. Farmer Jones still had not brought her morning oats. Feeling naughty, she snuck toward the apple orchard. Farmer Jones didn't know about the low spot in the fence, but Rosie did!
target: Rosie broke free to head to the orchard.

source: Rick was at the bar when he saw a driver license on the ground. He asked around if it was anybody's there. Of course it wasn't, and Rick didn't want to leave it with a stranger. So he decided to drive to the address of the license owner.
target: Rick gave the license to the driver and made the driver happy.

source: I started a diet yesterday. I ate healthy food the entire day! Today I saw pizza in the fridge. My willpower broke and I ate all 5 pieces.
target: I felt ashamed.

source: Sam and his wife were busy packing for their trip. He was really looking forward to this trip. He was excited to be able to spend a lot of time with her. They finished the packing and then smiled at each other.
target: Sam and his wife had a great time together.

source: Stan wanted to go on an adventure with Eric. But Eric's mom said that Eric could not come out and play. Stan begged and pleaded, but to no avail. Eric sneaked out of his house and knocked on Stan's window.
target: The two boys went out to have their adventure without hesitation.

source: Greg like to throw anything he could get his hands on. One day he threw a stone as far as he could. It went through the window of his neighbors house. He was scared but wanted to do the right thing.
target: Greg told his neighbor it was him.

source: Brad went to the beach. He made a sand castle. He jumped into the ocean waters. He swam with the small fish.
target: Brad then went home after a nice day.

source: Our puppy went outside to play. He rolled in the mud, which got caught in his fur. Once inside the house, we sent him to the bathroom. He jumped in the tub for a bath.
target: We gave him a bath.

source: Jerry had just learned to ride a bike and was excited to go for a ride. He started down the street near his house when he hit a pothole. His bike stopped immediately and flip him over it. He lay there screaming for help with no one in sight.
target: Jerry's mother took twenty minutes to find him.
