source: I decided to pay a visit to someone I've been dating online. I never seen her in person, but I trust her. The airplane flight took several hours. When I arrived at the hotel, she said she's in front.
target: I walked in and saw her.

source: I hired a social media manager. I thought they would drive more traffic to my website. They spent most of their time reading other people's posts. My traffic actually went down in the following month.
target: I decided to fire my new social media manager.

source: Sam's parents were out for the weekend. He decided to host a party. Many people came. The partiers ended up trashing the house.
target: Sam was in real trouble.

source: Today was the first day of school. I got to wear my new outfit that Mom bought. I met a lot of new friends. My favorite class is music.
target: I had a great time at school.

source: Sam bought a new television. It would not turn on. He pressed the on button several times. Finally Jeb came over to check it out.
target: Jeb plugged the television in and it turned on.

source: One day Matilda was extremely bored. So she picked a name and address out of the phone book. She wrote a silly letter to that random person. And the recipient wrote back to Matilda!
target: Matilda was told to not write to them anymore.

source: Bill and Teddy were at the bar together. Bill noticed a pretty girl. He went up to her to flirt but she didn't like him. He was too drunk to talk properly.
target: Bill and Teddy talked loudly about how stuck up pretty girls are.

source: Last night was very scary. We had a tornado warning and terrible thunderstorms. Unfortunately my concert for violin was not canceled. I was required to show up but during the performance lights went out.
target: We could not see our sheet music.

source: Janey and Lynne decided to go to the movies. Janie wanted to see a comedy, but Lynne wanted to see a thrill. When they got to the movie theater, they decided to make a compromise. They chose an action movie that had both comedic and thrilling parts.
target: They were both happy.

source: Oliva wanted to go shopping. She decided to go to the mall. She found a great sale on shoes. She bought three pairs.
target: Oliva had a great day shopping.

source: We are moving to a brand new house. Our old house is now too small for our family. We've packed all of our things. I'm very excited to move to our new home.
target: I only hope I get to choose my own bedroom.

source: Shawn woke and rose from the bed at 8:07 am. He reached for his cigarettes but the pack was empty. Shawn then threw on some sweats and headed to the corner store. There, he purchased a pack of Newports.
target: Shawn smoked them almost immediately.

source: Nickie had a toy doll. She loved her doll very much. One day she lost her doll. Nickie cried all day.
target: Nickie never found the doll.

source: Anna has lost twenty pound in three months. Her friends aren't sure what her secret is. Last week they decided to ask her. She said she was working out and eating better.
target: Anna's friends were surprised by her simple methods.

source: Bob wanted a hamburger. But he also wanted to eat healthier. So he decided to make a veggie burger. Bob thought it wasn't as good as a normal burger.
target: Bob went out to McDonald's later that evening.

source: After being injured, Tommy needed to go to the doctor. Quickly, his mother drove him downtown. There were a lot of people in the waiting room! After a while, a nurse came to see tommy.
target: Tommy was then treated and felt much better.

source: Maggie wanted to paint her room. She wanted to have a pink room. She ask her mom to buy her paint. The next day Maggie painted her room.
target: Maggie loved the color pink.

source: Ken met a nice man online, and they decided to go on a date. They met at a nice restaurant and shook hands. Ken and his date ordered food and had small talk. While they ate, Ken decided that he really liked the man.
target: Ken asked him for a second date.

source: Gary has a crush on Jamie. He gets very nervous around her. One day, he tried to show off in front of her. Instead, he fell down a flight of stairs.
target: Jamie came to the rescue and helped him.

source: Liz decided she was going to try to grow tomatoes. She had never grown anything before. She purchased seedlings from the garden center. All summer she looked after them like they were children!
target: Eventually they grew delicious tomatoes.

source: Bill wanted a sandwich. He got up and went into his kitchen. He gathered the materials for a sandwich. He made a sandwich.
target: He ate his sandwich.

source: Jack had his own pencil. It was blue with stars. One day he couldn't find it. He looked everywhere.
target: He finally found it under the bed.

source: I went to the store to buy a phone. It was extremely advanced. I brought it home and called all my friends. They wanted to see it too.
target: They were impressed with my phone.

source: John was cooking dinner last night. He was making pork chops. Unfortunately, he dropped a pan and burned himself. He had to go to the hospital.
target: John had a miserable evening.

source: Jenny found someone stole her lunch twice in the break room this week. She asked around and found out who did it. She confronted the person and they denied it. Jenny had security look at the camera footage.
target: They confirmed Jenny's suspicions.

source: Emma liked to paint. For her friend's birthday, she gave her a painting. Another person saw the painting at her friend's house. She called Emma and asked her to create paintings for her restaurant.
target: Emma was happy to have a new audience for her work.

source: Tom liked to look at old cars. For his birthday, his family got him tickets to a classic car museum. Tom thought it was a wonderful gift. His family accompanied him to the museum.
target: Tom loved his time at the museum.

source: Johnny takes a trip down the stairs at his home. Now Johnny has a bruised knee. His mom comforts him. Eventually Johnny feels better.
target: Johnny is more careful on the stairs from now on.

source: Mike is a busy man. He often eats fast food for breakfast. Mike wanted to enjoy a healthier breakfast. He tried an overnight oatmeal recipe.
target: Mike ate the oatmeal.

source: My teacher showed us how to build a wooden bird house. Everyone began to start on the experiment. I tried connecting the borders with nails. I ended up hitting my finger with the hammer.
target: I went to the hospital to fix my finger that I had broken.

source: Josh liked watching anime TV shows. When he criticized one of them, its fans got angry with him. Josh didn't understand why they couldn't accept criticism. Josh kept his opinions to himself.
target: Josh then decided to watch anime by himself.

source: John loves to eat at buffets. They are his favorite because he gets to eat as much as he wants. There was this great buffet right near his apartment he would go to. He found out that they went out of business last week.
target: John was sad to hear the news.

source: Jimbo has been working at the same job for Years. He always takes his smoke break at the same time. This week they got a new boss. The new boss doesn't allow smoke breaks.
target: Jimbo sneaks into a back room to smoke.

source: Lester was infatuated with Christina. He was a photographer and she was a graphic designer. Lester spent all his free time with Christina. Finally, she said she loved him and wanted children with him.
target: Lester asked her to marry him.

source: I decided I needed to finish a Sunday crossword. I turned off my computer so I wouldn't cheat. I turned off the TV so I wouldn't be distracted. I opened the paper to the Leisure section.
target: I finished the entire crossword puzzle in one hour.

source: I thought about getting a new hat for my head. After looking through images, I picked one out. This hat is going to be amazing! I quickly went to the store to purchase the hat.
target: Sadly it made me look like a potato.

source: Julia baked a cake. When it had cooled, she was ready to frost it. She covered it in pink frosting. Then, she made little frosting flowers.
target: After finishing, her cake looked very tasty.

source: Whit has a dog. It sleeps all the time. It doesn't just sleep like a normal dog. It snores like a human.
target: Whit doesn't sleep well.

source: Amy arrived home from volleyball practice and sat on the couch. Her mother walked in and gasped. She told Amy she needed to shower since she was sweaty. They argued since Amy thought it was no big deal.
target: Amy gave in and took a shower.

source: Today was Pinwheels for Peace Day. My teacher took the class towards the front of the school. Everyone planted pinwheels near the stop. When we looked at the wheels from afar, they were spinning.
target: Our teacher took a photo of the pinwheels.

source: Beth was expecting her first child. She was home doing light cleaning on a Sunday afternoon. All of a sudden her water broke. Beth was in labor for 2 days.
target: Beth gave birth to a beautiful baby boy.

source: Mia had never tried falafel. She didn't think she would like it. However, her friends talked her into trying it. She realized it was delicious!
target: Mia liked it so much she decided to learn how to make it.

source: I was bored when my daughter went to Kindergarten. I began to substitute teach at her school if a teacher was sick. I became very interested in why some kids have a harder time learning. This  led me to take a bunch of classes on special education.
target: I began to teach special education.

source: Gary always brought his lunch to work. Today Gary couldn't find his lunchbox. He figured he would just buy something out of the machine at work. When Gary took his lunch, he found out the machine was broken.
target: Gary was very upset and went hungry.

source: Jake was trying to fall asleep. He had an important test tomorrow. He rolled around in his bed all night. He tried drinking a big glass of warm milk.
target: Jake fell asleep after drinking the milk.

source: I was walking through the park one day. I noticed a man sitting by himself. I walked up to him and asked how he was. He told me about how he was very ill and sad.
target: I listened and told him I hoped he felt better.

source: Joe was interested in Einstein's General Theory of Relativity. He watched several documentaries about Einstein. Then, he read a book on the Theory of Relativity. Joe learned quite a lot about Einstein's scientific achievements.
target: He could not wait for his advanced physics class to start.

source: Bonnie needed a new job. She searched the newspaper employment section. She found a listing for a job as a nanny. She called the listed number to arrange an interview.
target: Bonnie got the job eventually.

source: Amy was playing in the back yard with her friends. Suddenly she saw a small snake slither across her arm! She shrieked and ran, but not before the snake bit her hand! Amy was terrified and called an ambulance right away.
target: The ambulance treated her snake bike.

source: Jerry told all his friends he was running a marathon. He had some of them sponsor him. He never actually prepared for it. He was freaking out on the day of it.
target: Jerry attempted to run the marathon but quickly collapsed,

source: Dave loved the outdoors. One day he decided to go on a hike. As he walking on the trail, he heard a hissing sound. To his right on the ground was a rattle snake!
target: Dave backed away slowly.

source: Logan always loved being outside. One day, while playing outside with his dog, Logan was stung by a bee. He cried in pain and raced home. Logan's mother put ice on the sting until it felt better.
target: Then he went back outside to play with the dog.

source: Skip's grades in school were getting worse and worse. His parents considered getting him a tutor. They noticed, however, that Skip was squinting a lot. They realized he needed glasses and not a tutor.
target: Skip got glasses and improved in class.

source: Rae's family sat down for Sunday lunch. Rae's brother accidentally spilled his drink. Rae's stepfather yelled and threw his plate across the room. Rae watched the plate shatter into a million pieces.
target: Rae went to fetch a broom.

source: Gina and her friend Lisa were listening to music in the garage. Gina hoped her other friends would come over and join them. She called them, but no one answered. The girls decided to dance to cure their boredom.
target: They all had a good time anyway.

source: The kids were very excited about christmas. They have been good all year. They sent a letter to Santa. Santa responded back in the mail.
target: They framed the letters and kept them for years,

source: I was feeling ill. I scheduled a doctor's appointment. I went to see the doctor. He ran some tests.
target: I found out I had the flu.

source: Christian's school was starting football tryouts. Christian decided to try out for the team. He practiced every day. He tried out for the team.
target: Christian got on the team.

source: Tim and Gina both hated doing the dishes. They would each alternate which week to do them. Last week Gina wasn't able to get to hers. She had been working longer hours than usual.
target: Tim did the dishes for Gina to be kind.

source: Timmy asked his mother for a pet. She told him that she could not afford to buy him one. Timmy was sad but he understood what his mother said. The next day, Timmy found a turtle in the creek.
target: Timmy asked his mom if he could keep that as a pet instead.

source: Jen brought her cat Lee to the vet for a checkup. The veterinarian, Doctor Mike, found three fleas on Lee. Doctor Mike suggested a flea dip to Jen. Jen refused because she did not want Lee to be dipped in chemicals.
target: Jen noticed that Lee's flea problem quickly got worse.

source: Mish got the text telling her she could leave now. Quickly, she ran to her car, keys in hand. She knew she had limited time, so she drove fast. When she got to the train station, she checked her watch.
target: She had just enough time to make the train.

source: Gina was searching for her phone in her dad's car. She was sure it would be there. But after checking everywhere she couldn't see it. She ran in the house and grabbed a flashlight.
target: Gina found her phone.

source: Sarah had an appointment to interview for a job. She put on her best skirt suit and headed to the interview. As she sat at the interview, Sarah noticed a run in her stockings. She was so focused on the flaw, she merely mumbled her replies.
target: Because of her replies, Sarah didn't get the job.

source: Linda and her boyfriend were hungry. She wanted to eat tacos. He wanted to eat fish. They both felt powerful, and couldn't decide what to eat between them.
target: Linda and her boyfriend ended up getting both.

source: Morris buys himself a skateboard to stay active. He brings the skateboard to the park for a day of skateboarding. He notices that he is much older than the other people there. However, they welcome him, and they don't seem to mind his age.
target: The younger skaters taught Morris a lot of tricks.

source: Ron liked to drink a lot of beer. His dad and his mom were both alcoholics. Ron decided it was best if he didn't drink anymore. He finally quit after 6 months.
target: Ron was proud of the decision he made.

source: Jane wanted long hair. So she let it grow for months and months. But it became difficult to take care of. And when it was summer, hair long hair made her too hot.
target: Jane decided to cut her hair short for summer.

source: Alex awoke to bright sunlight. She looked at her clock alarm. She realized she must have overslept! Alex jumped out of bed.
target: She was late for school.

source: I was eating lunch with friends at a new place. I asked for a Coke. They told me they only had Pepsi products. They asked me if I was fine with that.
target: I said i was fine with that.

source: Carl was in Florida and enjoying the day in his house. He was watching tv and out of no where an alert popped up. The alert warn the residents of a chance there will be a tsunami. Carl was scared and began evacuating.
target: Carl was able to reach a shelter before the storm hit.

source: We woke up this morning to light snow falling. We're excited that school is cancelled for the day. Everyone went outside to play in the snow. We built a snowman and used a carrot for the nose.
target: We found rocks to use for his eyes and mouth.

source: A squirrel had been visiting Joe's backyard. It would get a few feet from Joe then scurry away. Joe was trying to get it to take a peanut from his hand. One day the squirrel finally did.
target: Joe was happy.

source: Arnold bought a new television. He paid cash. After a couple of weeks it stopped working. He tried to return it but had lost his receipt.
target: Arnold was not allowed to return the television.

source: Eric was barely a day over 21. But he already had a drinking problem. Eric woke up and yelped the nearest bar. He hopped in his car half asleep and headed to the place.
target: Pretty soon, he was drunk and passed out at the bar.

source: Ellie was at dancing as hard as she could at a new club. All of a sudden she realized she felt an unusual breeze. The seam of her pants in the back had ripped all the way open. She quickly backed off the dance floor.
target: Ellie had to find a new pair of pants quick.

source: Driving home from work the other day I got a flat tire. It was rainy and cold out. I could have called the towing company but chose not to. Instead I changed the tire myself.
target: I was miserable but saved a ton.

source: I found my shoes uncomfortably stiff. I went out and bought some new shoes. I tried to break them in over time. They still felt too stiff for me.
target: The shoes gave me blisters.

source: Marcus was just starting his first flying lesson. He was learning to fly small commuter planes. He was nervous to take the plane up in the air. His instructor helped him take off from the airport.
target: Marcus relaxed once they were in the air.

source: Larry has decided to help out his friends prepare for a party. He needs to bring a salad to the party. Larry slices tomato, lettuce, and other vegetables for the salad. When it is finished, he feels great.
target: Larry was happy that he could contribute to the party.

source: Sarah had never been on a boat before. Today her mom took her to the pier for her very first boat ride. Sarah was very excited. She stepped on the boat and heard the engine roar.
target: She loved every minute of it.

source: Neil wanted to see a historical spot on his trip to London. He took a bus tour to an old prison. It was called the Tower of London. Neil learned the history of the impressive tower.
target: He was fascinated.

source: I bought a backup drive for my wife's iPhone. She was running out of space on her phone. She has 1200 photos on her phone. I tried to back up her photos to a drive, but failed.
target: There were too many photos to upload.

source: Doug's wife was upset with him. As a way to ask forgiveness he decided to buy her a new car battery. He changed it out and made sure her car was working properly. She appreciated the gesture.
target: Doug's wife kissed him.

source: Grace always loved playing tricks on the teacher. Her favorite trick was to hide all of the chalk from the teacher. One day as she was hiding the chalk, the teacher caught Grace. She was suspended from school for two weeks.
target: Grace decided to stop playing tricks at school.

source: Jane's mother made a very good apple pie. Jane always wanted the recipe but her mother wouldn't give it to her. One Christmas, she asked her again for the recipe. Jane's mother decided that she would give her the recipe.
target: Jane was thankful to have the recipe.

source: Mark opened the back door of the restaurant and walked outside. It was the time of the day to take out the trash. Halfway to the dumpster, he saw many birds, feeding on the trash. He had gone hungry before so he knew all things must eat.
target: He felt bad for the birds.

source: Last night we wanted to order a pizza. Half of us wanted pepperoni. The other half wanted sausage. I made a decision.
target: We ordered a pizza with separate toppings on each half.

source: Simon noticed a moving truck in front of the house next door. The family moving in had a teenage daughter and Simon was smitten. He worked up the courage to go over and introduce himself. She was shy but friendly and receptive enough to encourage him.
target: He hung out with her all day.

source: Johnny was on his local Little League team. One Saturday, his team had a very important game. His parents were able to attend. Johnny's team won the game.
target: Johnny was elated.

source: Ben was late for class. His teacher yelled at him. He came in late the next day. His teacher wrote a note to his parents.
target: Ben's mother will now wake him  up  one half  hour earlier .

source: Ally wished for her boyfriend to pick her out a beautiful ring. She left jewelry store fliers on the counter. Next, she circled rings in magazines. She even mentioned them out loud in phone conversations.
target: Ally couldn't wait to get engaged.

source: I was so excited yesterday that usher released a new song. I immediately purchased it. When I listened to it I was blown away. I immediately put it on my phone.
target: I listened to the song all day.

source: A new band wanted for their song to get popular fast. They bribed several radio DJs to play their song all at the same time. When people tuned in the radio, the same song played on all stations. They became a huge success overnight.
target: They were very excited about being well known.

source: Annie was the top gymnast in her class. She received many awards and competed a lot. One day after a competition she remembered overdue homework. Her teacher would not let her turn in the homework.
target: She failed the class.

source: Patricia was spell-bound as soon as she looked into a microscope. She couldn't believe there was another world she couldn't see. Immediately she knew she was going to become a biologist. The next 8 Years, she studied science in school and college.
target: Patricia eventually became a biologist.

source: Lily never really enjoyed sports. Over the summer she watched the women's world cup with her family. She was inspired and decided to join a soccer team. The team had been playing for a while and she was behind.
target: She eventually got better.

source: Marisse went to the auction to look for some items. At the registration desk, they asked her for her credit card. She took out some cash instead and used that as a deposit. She went on to bid on some storage lockers and won two.
target: Sadly, they were both filled with junk.

source: One year, Jessica went to summer camp. She had a great time. The following year, she was too old to attend the camp. However, she was old enough to work there.
target: She was excited to get to work at the camp.

source: Gina had gotten her phone back from a teacher. He had kept it 2 days. Her mother was becoming suspicious. Now she would be able to keep it secret that it was ever taken.
target: Gina's mother never found out that her phone was taken away.

source: Meg couldn't find her favorite gold earrings. She was beginning to suspect the new maid had stolen them! Her husband admonished her to search the house more carefully. Meg realized that perhaps they had been vacuumed up by mistake!
target: Meg checked the vacuum and then found them.

source: Marcy wondered about the kids. She had been in the kitchen and hadn't heard them in awhile. Usually, when the kids were quiet, they were getting into something. Marcy looked in the bedrooms and didn't see them.
target: She found them in the living room reading and was relieved.

source: Ori's mom sent him off to the market. She admonished him to remember the brown eggs. But Ori couldn't find them at the market. He had to check three different stores.
target: He finally decided to buy white eggs instead.

source: A week before Christmas, Abby and her family got together. They went to a local nursing home, wearing Santa hats. They went from room to room, singing Christmas carols. Some of the patients sang with them.
target: They all had a very memorable time together.

source: Maggie and her classmates went to a zoo for their field trip. They saw monkeys, gorillas and panda's first. After that, they saw snakes and lizards! They even got to feed some of the baby animals.
target: Maggie loved her trip to the zoo.

source: Vianna was a full-time college student. She did not have a job and she needed money. She searched online for ways to make money from home. She found a site named amazon turk and started working from there.
target: Vianna now works everyday.

source: Everyone in my family got together for Thanksgiving. It was a long journey for many, but they made it. We all sat together and ate dinner. After dinner, we visited and caught up.

source: Jim complained that his wife never did the dishes. She then complained that Jim never cooked dinner. The next day they decided to switch their roles. The meal was horrible and dishes didn't get cleaned well enough.
target: They both decided to go back to their previous roles.

source: Lina has two kids. Lina was cleaning their rooms and realized their drawers were stuffed. She began to sort through the clothes. Lina had a big pile of clothes that were too small for her kids.
target: Lina gave the clothes to charity.

source: Anna wanted a banana milkshake. Her local ice cream shop didn't have that flavor. She went home and got out her blender. Then she added her own bananas and ice cream.
target: Anna thought her own milkshake tasted just as delicious.

source: I got into my car and closed the door. I turned the engine on and started to drive. I was headed in the direction of the gas station. It was lunch time and I was starting to get hungry.
target: I decided to buy chips at the gas station.

source: Tommy recently landed a position on his school's Debate team. They were having a debate tonight. He was pretty nervous. When he got there, the entire school was watching.
target: Tommy ended up doing well regardless of his nerves.

source: Jill was a high school student. She dreaded having to go to class. One day, she decided to ditch school. Her parents found out the next day.
target: Jill's parents scolded her for skipping class.

source: Alex was getting fits of dizziness. He was so nervous that he checked his symptoms online. The online results convinced him that he had a terrible disease. He scheduled an appointment with his doctor in a hurry.
target: Alex found out his blood sugar was low.

source: Chris went shopping for a new car. While on the lot, he saw plenty of cars but none that he liked. He was about to leave when he spotted it. The shiny red car was right in front of him, begging him to buy it.
target: Chris bought the red car.

source: At a party on Friday everyone decided to play musical chairs. The game involved dozens of people. Eventually it was narrowed down to two. It was two girls.
target: The tall, brown haired girl won the game.

source: Henry wanted to play a scavenger hunt for his son's birthday party. A list of items to retrieve was created first. He turned to neighbors and nearby businesses for help. After placing items in appropriate places he had to create the hints.
target: The kids loved the scavenger hunt.

source: Jake had a hard time making friends at his new school. He had low self esteem and felt didn't deserve to have friends. One day he met John who happened to feel the same way. John and Jake soon became best friends.
target: They both became more confident and made more friends too.

source: Sean was born into an Irish immigrant family. He was always proud of his Irish heritage. His family kept customs, ate Irish food, and watched Irish sports. Sean saved up money and paid for a big trip to Ireland.
target: He was thrilled when he was finally on his way to Ireland.

source: Todd was not careful with his electrical appliances. He plugged in an old toaster with a frayed cord. When he was out of the room, he smelled a strange sound. The toaster had caught fire!
target: He used a fire extinguisher to save the day.

source: Beth was making mashed potatoes from scratch. After cooking the potatoes it was time to mash them. Her mother didn't have a food processor, Beth had to mash by hand. It was hard work which took hours.

source: John and Sue often kissed at school in between classes. They were told not to do it but they did anyway. One day the principal caught the two kissing. They were both suspended for a week.
target: They both learned their lesson and no longer kissed in school.

source: Biff wanted to watch a western movie. Biff also wanted to watch a movie in theaters. Westerns had lost favor with the public and none were showing. Biff decided to screen a classic western himself.
target: He enjoyed watching the western.

source: After I got out of the bus, I walked to the front of the school. I was happy to see some of my friends again. When I walked into first period, it was very familiar. The teacher seemed very good.
target: I was relaxed and happy.

source: Ashley's dog has fleas and is scratching himself. Ashley was very worried that she would get fleas as well. She went to the store and put flea and tick shampoo. Ashley then went home and gave her dog a bath.
target: Ashley killed all the fleas.

source: I lived in the South End of Boston from 1968 to 1981. It was a run down section of town. I bought many books there, since they cost only ten cents. I revisited the shop in 1991.
target: It was very different.

source: My daughter had been begging for a pet. Her birthday was coming up. I visited the pet store to do some research. The workers helped me make a decision.
target: I bought her a dog.

source: Kaylee always wanted a puppy. On her birthday her parents took her to a farm. There were lots of beagle puppies there. Her parents told her she could pick a puppy for her birthday.
target: Kaylee was thrilled!

source: Neil was backpacking Europe. He had just arrived in Dover. He loved how friendly the people were! He also loved their delicious food.
target: Neil was having a great time.

source: Alice wanted to go to school to become a veterinarian. She worked hard all throughout high school to have good grades. She even volunteered at the local zoo to pad her resume. When the time came, she applied to many different schools.
target: She cried of joy when she received her first acceptance letter.

source: My laptop didn't want to work. It stopped turning on for some reason. I tried a few different things to fix it. Finally I got a new charger off the internet.
target: Now it comes on every time.

source: My laboratory professor was explaining today's lab. He told us not to pour water followed by an acid. While I was looking at my notes, I barely paid attention. When the experiment began, I poured water before an acid in a tube.
target: My professor was very upset.

source: Jack liked to take trips on the weekends with his friends. They often liked to go skiing in the mountains. Jack theorized that this weekend would have perfect skiing weather. He told his friends to drive with him up to the resort.
target: They rented a car and had a wonderful time skiing.

source: Brad was sick with a cold! He wanted to go out and play! He was too weak to move. His mother gave him soup and medicine.
target: Brad's mother was very caring.

source: Barry had only one thousand dollars left in his bank account. He needed to find a job. He searched for 3 months. Eventually, his money ran out.
target: He had to go to a homeless shelter.

source: Michael likes to go to the beach but has trouble swimming. During a beach trip his friends made a dare to him. They told him to go into deep water and he did. Michael got tired when he was out and started to yell for help.
target: His friends helped him back to the shore.

source: Juan wanted to make tacos for his family tonight. He went to the grocery store and bought the ingredients. As he was preparing dinner he realized he forgot the tortillas! He wanted to go back to the store but it was closed.
target: Juan's mother showed him how to make a taco casserole instead.

source: Lena was sick. Lena was sad because she wouldn't see her friends at school. So she took her vitamins. She got better quickly
target: Lena went to school only to find out her friends were sick.

source: Jim was farting a lot more than usual. His wife became concerned because they smelled unusually terrible. She insisted that he go see a doctor. Jim's doctor told him he is becoming lactose intolerant.
target: Jim's wife was relieved to find the source of the problem.

source: Tim bought a new lamp today. He went home to set it up. Tim opened the box and followed the instructions. He assembled the lamp within five minutes.

source: Sandy had taken dance for ten Year's. She was about to graduate and wanted to tryout for dance team. She practiced and practiced. On the day of tryouts, she broke her toe.
target: She could not participate in the tryout with the injury.

source: Gina and her friend Tami were walking to their classroom. Down the hall Gina could see he bully who had tripped her. Gina tried to keep her composure. She took a deep breath and put on a weak smile.
target: Tami told the bully to get lost, and he looked intimidated.

source: Morgan loved tea. She bought a travel mug to bring tea with her to school. She drank all of her tea on the drive to school. So, when she got to school, she had to fill up with more hot water.
target: Morgan was glad she remembered to bring extra tea bags with her.

source: Beth started collecting dolls. She bought dolls online and at flea markets and antique shops. Soon Beth's house was full of dolls. When a friend came to visit, there was no room to chat in the house.

source: Jim was in a go cart race. He designed his go kart by himself. While he raced, his tires fell off. He didn't know what to do.

source: Bob was warm and tender towards his wife. He wanted to get her a very special gift for Valentine's Day. He asked all the people he knew what he should get her. They all had different opinions, leaving Bob confused.

source: Ida had tickets to a two-day outdoor music festival. She was sad when it began to rainy on day one. But then she saw that other attendees weren't upset. They just danced in the rainy, so I followed suit.

source: Jeff was walking home to only see a tornado at a distance. Jeff knew he was in danger so he went to a nearby house. He rang the doorbell and asked if he can stay until tornado dies off. The homeowner let Jeff inside.
target: They huddled in the bathroom as the tornado raged overhead.

source: Charles was happy to meet a record company executive on Facebook. Charles asked to write about the executive's artist. The executive said yes, as long as the story was published. Vibe Magazine offered to publish the story on speculation.

source: Anna wanted to bake a cake for her mom's birthday. She tried twice, but both cakes fell flat. Then she found a solution. She went to the bakery and bought a cake.

source: Ron had just found out that his family was moving to a farm. Ron was nervous. He knew nothing about animals. But when he got to the new home, he was surprised.

source: Ron has anger problems. During a trip to the store, he got angry at a slow cashier. The cashier was sassy, and egged him on further. Ron grabbed the cashier by the shirt, and pulled him over the counter.

source: My friend and I decided to start a band and perform for our families. I was singer and my friend played guitar. We practiced in my garage. Eventually, we got pretty good.

source: A boy Jack had been asking his parents to get a puppy for months. After all the time he asked they finally gave in and said yes. Jack spent about thirty minutes looking online for a puppy. He found one in the area that he lived.
target: Jack then showed the online puppy and pleaded with them to get it.

source: On a cool Saturday afternoon Amy was in her backyard alone. She was practicing her volleyball skills when her dad came out. He offered to help her practice. Amy was grateful.
target: They practiced together.

source: Jon loved the night sky. He would spend many of his nights looking at the stars. His mom saw that he loved the night sky. His mom bought him a telescope.
target: Jon used his telescope often.

source: Jack went on a trip to the store. He really needed to buy some eggs. He looked everywhere but could not find them! He asked the clerk where they were.
target: The clerk told him to find the eggs.

source: Jimmy climbed on to the counter while his Mom was distracted. He nimbly scurried to where the stove burner glowed red. Jimmy screamed when his outreached hand touched the burner. His Mom appeared instantly and whisked him away from it.

source: Billy buried some treasure in his backyard. He drew a map so he wouldn't forget where he'd put it. Years passed and Billy's family moved. Decades later, he went back and used his map to dig it back up.
target: He found many treasures from his childhood.

source: My mom took me grocery shopping. She let me pick out all the food. I picked out a lot of candy and snacks! Then, she went to the register and paid for it all.
target: I ate a lot of candy that day.

source: Mike always had Golden Retriever dogs when he was growing up. Now that he had a steady job, he felt ready to have a dog too. Mike got a Golden Retriever and named him Spot. Now Mike and Spot take walks in the park every weekend.
target: Mike loves his faithful friend Spot very much.

source: Joe got fired from his job. He was sad. He needed money for bills. He called  up grant.
target: Grant loaned Joe some money.

source: Jimmy needed to learn to code for his job. He looked online for a lesson. He found a website to teach him to code. Every day he applied himself to the endeavor.
target: After a long time, he learned to code properly.

source: Rakesh decides that he would like to cook lobster for dinner. He visits the local seafood market and picks a huge lobster. Rakesh brings it home and boils it in water. He eats the lobster with butter and corn on the cob.
target: Rakesh loved eating lobster.

source: When I was sixteen I learned to drive. The first time I got into the car I lost track of the brake pedal. I didn't know how to stop! My dad had to turn on the emergency brake.
target: After that mistake, I became much more cautious.

source: Ron woke up and looked out the window. The street was covered in a foot of snow! School was canceled that day. Ron spent the whole day playing in the snow with his friends.
target: Ron was very happy.

source: My brother loved candy. He ate a lot of it. He left the wrappers on the counter. Our mother scolded him for it.
target: He didn't listen until we got a lot of ants one spring.

source: Brad wanted eggs for breakfast. Brad was all out of eggs! Brad cried for a long time. Brad's mother came home with eggs!
target: Brad had delicious Eggs Benedict.

source: Paulo had always wanted to serve in his student council. However, he was worried he wouldn't be elected. Paulo asked many students for their support in the election. Finally on election day, Paulo was elected to student council.
target: Paulo felt proud of his accomplishment.

source: Patrick's parents raised ducks. One day, Patrick was playing near the ducks. One of the ducks started chasing him! The duck caught up to Patrick and bit him on the leg.
target: It didn't break the skin, but Patrick was scared and cried!

source: Last night I attended a cocktail party. I wore my new white dress. Everyone at the party loved it. However to my dismay I spilled wine all over it.
target: I was so angry at myself!

source: I am a different person than I used to be. I used to be heavyset but I lost weight. I took up swimming and lost the weight. I worked out three times week and ate healthy every day.
target: I am much healthier now.

source: Kelly went to a Celtics game yesterday. She loved going to games. The clock was ticking and time was running out. Thankfully the Celtics won.
target: Kelly jumped for joy.

source: Jane's girlfriend works at a flower shop. She never gets tired of her work. One day Jane decided to get her a rose. Even though her girlfriend saw many a day she loved it.
target: Jane's girlfriend was a die-hard flower lover.

source: Michael loved to go hiking in the woods on weekends. He had never made it to the top of a mountain. One day he climbed very high,and finally reached the top. He could see land and water on the other side of the mountain.
target: Michael loved the view and hoped to return.

source: Damon lost his wallet with his ID in it. He searched all over the house. He couldn't find it anywhere. He eventually just went and got a replacement ID.
target: The next day, Damon found his wallet under the bed.

source: David and Mia rarely got to go out since they had young children. One Friday, they were finally able to get away to see a movie. They were looking forward to it so much, but it turned out to be bad! In fact, it was so bad that they could barely contain their giggles.
target: David and Mia decided to leave the movie.

source: Bob was going to take his daughter to see Grandma. The two drove to Grandma's house a few miles down the street. Grandma welcomed them with open arms. The 3 of them had a big dinner at night.
target: Bob's daughter thanked Grandma for the delicious meal.

source: Sue's cat was nowhere to be seen. Sue searched for her cat for hours until she heard purring outside. Her cat was stuck in the tree. Sue called up the fire department.
target: Suzi's cat was saved.

source: Ava brought home a catfish. She put it into her tank. She wasn't sure how the other fish would react. She watched apprehensively.
target: All the fish got along fine.

source: I love to go to the movies. I used to go almost every single weekend. There was a theater about ten minutes from my house that was decent. It closed down though and now I have to drive far to see movie.
target: It costs more for gas to the other theater.

source: I bought a new car today. It is shiny and red. The inside smells so fresh and clean. I love the car so much.
target: I drive the car everywhere I go.

source: Teresa was an artist. She made a beautiful sculpture of an angel. She entered it into an art contest. The judges liked the sculpture very much.
target: She won the contest and was proud of herself.

source: My dog waited for me by the house front door. We walked to the park for playtime and exercise. The dog and I walked around the block before returning home. When we walked through the front door, she took a big drink of water.
target: Then she lay down and took a nap.

source: Matt found a puppy wandering down the street. It looked lost and scared, so Matt took it home. Matt's mom called some neighbors, and eventually found its owner. The puppy's owner was so relieved to know his puppy was safe!
target: The puppy's owner gave Matt a reward for finding it.

source: Mike bought a new bike to ride in his town. He cycled from his house to a friend's house. On the way he met a group of kids riding bikes as well. Neiter Mike nor the kids were wearing helmets at the time.
target: Mike accidentally collided with the kids.

source: Lucy placed a pan of food into the oven. She set a timer and sat down to watch television. After awhile, she smelled smoke. Quickly, she checked the timer and realized it never went off.
target: Lucy realized the meal was burned.

source: Tim's history class was first thing in the morning. He arrived to class very tired. He started to nod off. When he woke up, class was almost over.
target: Tim failed the final exam.

source: Amy called her internet provider for help. She explained her issue to the representative. They person gave an answer that in no way acknowledged her issue. Amy repeated her issue to no avail.
target: Amy hung up the phone angrily.

source: Sam regretted not starting his history essay earlier. He typed up his closing paragraphs. All of a sudden, his screen was covered in a large blue error message. Sam shrugged and restarted his computer.
target: He was disappointed in his broken computer.

source: Doug and Molly decided to go the park to take a walk. While they were there they found a stray dog. They carried the dog back to their apartment. They posted an ad online to try to find the owner.
target: They never found the owner and kept the dog.

source: Bill's father told him to keep practicing his piano scales. He was an expert pianist, and wanted the same for his son. Bill was too young to understand the value of practice. He bitterly sat at the piano, playing his scales over and over.
target: As Bill got older, he realized all of that practice help him.

source: Carlos decides to take a walk to get fresh air. Unfortunately, he slips on a wet leaf in the park. Carlos has hurt his knee on this walk. He limps home.
target: Afterwards Carlos puts a bandage on his knee.

source: Lance wanted to have a romantic evening with his wife. He put the kids to bed early and started dinner. He forgot to check the cooking and burned down the kitchen. His wife arrived to the fire department.
target: His wife was so angry she took the kids to sleep at the Grandmas.

source: Keith went to a pet store to see the animals. The store had fish, small animals, and a few puppies. The fish were of all different colors and sizes. Keith petted a few of the puppies.
target: Keith watched some of the colorful fish.

source: Maria wanted to learn Spanish. She decided to fully immerse herself in it. She bought a one way ticket to Spain. After six months, Maria could speak fluent Spanish.
target: Maria was proud to learn a new language so quickly.

source: Jay got stuck in an elevator on his way out of his office. It stopped between floors and the lights flickered. Jay was terrified! He battled his claustrophobia for two hours.
target: After two hours firefighters came and rescued Jay.

source: Ben was babysitting. He had never babysat before and he was nervous. He found that the little boy was fun to watch, though. Soon he and the kid were laughing and playing games.
target: He ended up babysitting to pay for college.

source: Ted always wanted to be a senator. He finally got the chance to run. He was eager to make a difference. Unfortunately a personal issue derailed his campaign.
target: Ted decided to run for county magistrate a year later.

source: Julie had a pretty pink ball that she loved to bounce outside. One day, it bounced too far and went into the street. It rolled down the hill and over the curb. It then rolled into the creek.
target: Next time she got a ball she was more careful with it.

source: The hubby and I decided to have a date night tonight. We haven't had one in almost a year. Mama came over to watch the kids. We went to dinner and a movie.
target: We thanked Mama for her huge favor.

source: Bob decided to hike in the jungles of Indonesia. He bought a plane ticket and packed his bags. When he arrived, he realized he forgot his malaria vaccine. He decided to hike the jungle regardless.
target: Bob had always been reckless.

source: John had had a bike since he was 14. John is now in his early 40's. John's son, Carl, just turned ten. Carl showed interest in his dad's bike in the garage.
target: Carl decided to give the bike to his son.

source: Kim had eaten deer meat without knowing what type of meat it was. She found the thought disgusting. She ran to the bathroom as she gagged. By the time she reached the bathroom the gagging had subsided.
target: She slowly drank a glass of water to calm her stomach.

source: Carl looked into a telescope for the first time at 9-Year's-old. He was immediately breath-taken and full of wonder. He decided he had to learn more about the cosmos. He studied science and astronomy through high school and college.
target: He ended up becoming a scientist.

source: Julie had a coworker named Barry who loved to make trouble for others. Barry told Julie, who was new, that she should dress up for Halloween. Julie, who was naive, came to work dressed as a cat on Halloween. She was the only one in costume!
target: Julie was incredibly embarrassed.

source: James loved to challenge himself physically. He decided to begin training for a marathon. James began running every day before work. Finally James ran the marathon.
target: James finished in the top 50.

source: I was riding my bike to work one summer morning. I was a little late, so I was in a hurry. I was biking a little recklessly. To my dismay, my reckless biking caused me to get in an accident.
target: From then on, I made sure to leave myself plenty of travel time.

source: Gina whispered to Mary in detention. The girls giggled together. Gina could tell the teacher wasn't pleased. They continued to whisper.
target: The teacher told them to stop talking.

source: Daniel got home from a night out on the town. He noticed the lights in his home wouldn't turn on. He checked the fridge. It was not on.
target: Daniel went to check the breaker box.

source: The cop pulled me over at night. He said I had been speeding. He went back to his car. I waited with the lights flashing behind me.
target: I hoped he would just give me a warning.

source: Melissa was tired of trying to get her son up for school everyday. He was always late going out the door. Melissa asked her mother for advice. She decided to try one of her mother's suggestions out.
target: Melissa's mother suggested putting her son to bed earlier.

source: Mark was a pro wrestler. He was getting ready for a big fight. He was nervous but practiced tediously. On the night of the fight he had won all rounds.
target: Mark became famous and made a lot of money.

source: Rex has always wanted to visit Argentina. He saves up his money for the big trip. Finally he has booked his flight to Argentina. He eats delicious food and drinks many types of wine.
target: Rex enjoys himself.

source: Ken really wanted to play the organ. One day he saw one at a yard sale. He stopped by the house and negotiated a price. Ken then loaded the organ into his truck.
target: He took the organ home and learned to play it beautifully.

source: Jay and Bella loved fish tanks. They had everything they needed for a new tank except for some plants. They set the tank up and ordered some plants from a web site. It took 2 weeks for the plants to arrive.
target: They bought some fish.

source: May invited her friends for a picnic in the park. After she arrived, she realized she had forgotten the ice! Now none of the drinks would be cold! Luckily, her friends had a sense of humor.
target: They had a wonderful picnic, despite the warm drinks.

source: Sandra had always wished for a pet turtle. She told her parents she would be responsible for it. At first her parents didn't agree. Eventually Sandra convinced her parents she should get a turtle.
target: She loved her new turtle.

source: A group of children played marbles one afternoon. Or at least, they tried to. There was a great deal of arguing. Ultimately, they gave up and played something else.
target: The children decided to play hide and go seek instead.

source: Francisco was excited to become an accountant one day. He knew that he would have to work hard to achieve that dream. He studied accounting at the local university. He passed all his exams!
target: Francisco became an accountant.

source: Jessica wanted to feed the birds without buying feeders. She gathered a bunch of pinecones under the trees. Strands of ribbon were attached to each one. She rolled the pinecones in peanut butter and bird seed.
target: She hung the pinecones from the trees and waited for the birds.

source: Last Friday I ate lunch with my niece. We went to a restaurant that had a jungle theme. My niece was excited because the restaurant was so cool. We ate our meals, and shared a dessert.
target: This would be our new favorite restaurant.

source: Betsy comes home late one night and wants to eat something simple. She notices that she has spaghetti and sauce in the house. She quickly cooks and eats a pot of spaghetti. After eating, she falls asleep on the couch.
target: She was full and happy.

source: Han and Leia once fought in a great battle together. Leia's brother also fought with them. They were all heros. Many Year's later, Han and Leia had a child.
target: Their child looked like both of them.

source: Gina was not supposed to use her phone in detention. So when she dropped the phone she knew it was trouble. The teacher held the phone and stared at her. Gina pretended it wasn't her phone.
target: Gina's teacher wasn't fooled at all and gave her more detention.

source: Jill had problems breathing one day. She went to the doctor and she discovered she had anxiety. She began to practice meditation. Her anxiety is now under control.
target: Jill was glad she went to the doctor.

source: Jan had to pick up her daughter after class. In a hurry, she drove to school in housecoat and slippers. Jan waited in the car for her daughter, who didn't show up. Worried, Jan went to the door of the class to find her daughter.
target: Then she realized it was Saturday.

source: Sara was a dancer. She was practicing for her recital. As she went to go on pointe, she heard a loud pop. Sarah broke her big toe.
target: Sara cried out in pain.

source: Pat takes a bus from New York to New Jersey every day for work. He doesn't like his commute. Year's go by and Pat is now an old man. He realizes he should have moved to New Jersey Years ago.
target: Pat thinks about all the time he wasted commuting.

source: Todd played hockey. Tonight was the big game. All his friends would be there. He was nervous.
target: Todd's knees shook as he skated because he was nervous.

source: Joan kept waking up from her roommate playing music. She complained that she had trouble sleeping. Her roommate promised to be more considerate. Her roommate began wearing headphones.
target: Joan was thankful that her roommate was so caring.

source: A man named Pete got off of work. After work, he drove to the gym. He went into the gym and found a workout machine. While working out, Pete worked up a sweat.
target: He showered after he finished working out.

source: Clare wanted to go for a walk. So she went outside and walked around her block. But the sun began to rise. And Clare began feeling hot.
target: She took off her jacket to cool off.

source: Nina needed cash for a prom dress. She decided to deliver papers to earn money. She rode her bike passing out papers. After a week, it was time to collect her pay.
target: She earned enough to buy the dress.

source: Gina and her friend Tami were walking around the playground. They talked for 5 minutes. Now they were out of thing to discuss. Gina racked her brain but could find nothing to say.
target: They just walked comfortably in silence for a while.

source: Harry was especially talented at computer repair. His mother called him over to fix her computer. He could not figure out what was wrong with it. Finally, he realized the problem.
target: Harry quickly fixed the problem for his mother.

source: I've noticed a lot lately that people are scamming good requesters. Just today I watched them scam a requester I had grown to love. After thinking about what to do I decided to send an email. The requester was very responsive and decided to talk to me.
target: I like helping others.

source: Stacy bought a bag of chips. She took them to the park to eat a snack. Her friend Kevin was also at the park. Stacey shared her chips with Kevin.
target: Kevin thanked Stacy and they enjoyed their time at the park.

source: Dana's mother came to visit for a week. Dana's husband Glenn thinks her mother is trying to poison him. During breakfast Glenn stomach starts to cramp. Glen becomes outraged.
target: However, turns out to just be gas.

source: Kendall was exhausted. She had about twelve different shows to do this fashion week. The work was tiring. Thankfully the pay was good.
target: Next week she would relax when it was all over.

source: When I was young we used to drive from Florida to Michigan yearly. We would pack up all our stuff and load them into the truck. We would leave early in the morning to make the most of our time. Driving, eating, and sleeping were the only reasons we would stop.
target: My dad always drove safely and we arrived quickly.

source: Gill's favorite character was Columbo portrayed by Peter Falk. Gill had seen every episode. Gill even owned all of them, including the many later seasons. Gill started acting like Columbo sometimes.
target: Her attempts at solving murders, however, were less successful.

source: Chad wanted to bowl a perfect game. Last Saturday he came close. He had all strikes and only needed two more. He missed his second to last one.
target: He did not miss the last one, but was still disappointed.

source: He watched in anger from outside the window. The lovers were oblivious to his presence. He burst through the door and was atop them in moments. The other man struggled but he was too weak to prevent his own demise.
target: His cheating wife called the police and he was arrested.

source: Ivan got bitten by a mosquito on a forest hike. The bite was red and itchy, but it didn't bother him at first. Then it swelled up terribly and became sore. A doctor looked at it and told Ivan the bite was infected!
target: Ivan bought mosquito repellent for his next hike.

source: Paige was a very good student. She always got the best grades out of her friends. However one week she got very sick. She fell behind in her studies.
target: Paige had to rely on her friends for their support.

source: One day, John met a cute girl named Jessica. He enjoyed talking to her and spending time with her. John asked Jessica to go out with him on a date. She said yes, and they had a good time.
target: John was glad he asked her on a date.

source: The flute that sits on the shelf covered in dust. One day a man comes in the store and takes it home. This man wipes away the dust. He starts playing a song.
target: The flute sounded beautiful.

source: Maggie was scared and excited to go on the space mountain ride. Her and her mother waited in line for what seemed like two hours. When the line was shorter the two got to the front. They stepped in the cars and put on their seatbelts.
target: The ride was very fun for Maggie.
